Turk_Translation_4: The MQM is an ally of the government, the Muslim League (N) is supporting it from behind, and the Muslim League (Q) is the party which will get the 17th Amendment passed. Then how it is possible that these parties are sincere about abolishing the 17th Amendment?

Urdu: یہ تو رنگ لگا کر شہیدوں میں نام لکھوانے کا بہانہ ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: This is a way for them to appear to be martyrs.
Turk_Translation_2: This is clearly an excuse to claim a big reward for a marginal effort.
Turk_Translation_3: This is sheer cheating.
Turk_Translation_4: This is just eyewash.

Urdu: پیپلز پارٹي کو تو ویسے ہی سترہویں ترمیم ختم کرنے کی جلدی نہیں ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: The People's Party is in no hurry to get the seventeenth amendment annulled anyway.
Turk_Translation_2: Anyway, the Peoples Party is not in a hurry to eliminate the Seventeenth Amendment.
Turk_Translation_3: In any case, Peoples Party is in no hurry to repeal the 17th amendment.
Turk_Translation_4: As it is, the People's Party is not in a hurry to abolish the 17th Amendment.

Urdu: بھلا کوئی کیسے اپنے ہاتھ کٹوانے کا سوچ سکتا ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: Why would anyone want to get their own hands cut off?
Turk_Translation_2: How can one think of cutting his own hands.
Turk_Translation_3: How can one think of cutting one's own hands?
Turk_Translation_4: How can one think of getting his own hands chopped off?

Urdu: جب تک ذرداری صدر ہیں سترہویں ترمیم ختم ہونے والی نہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: As long as Zardari is president, the seventeenth amendment is not about to be annulled.
Turk_Translation_2: As long as Zardari is president, the Seventeenth Amendment is unlikely to be done away with.
Turk_Translation_3: As long as Zardari is the president, the 17th amendment won't be repealed.
Turk_Translation_4: The 17th Amendment cannot be abolished as long as Zardari is there.

Urdu: یہی ہمارے ایک سروے میں اکثریت کی رائے تھی اور ہے بھی سچ۔
Turk_Translation_1: This was the majority opinion in one of our surveys, and it's true as well.
Turk_Translation_2: This was the majority opinion in one of our surveys and this is true as well.
Turk_Translation_3: This precisely was the opinion of the majority of the people in one of our recent surveys and this is also the truth.
Turk_Translation_4: This is what majority of us said in a survey, and this only is true.

Urdu: اگر سترہویں ترمیم ختم کرنی ہوتی تو پھر ذرداری صدر کبھی نہ بنتے۔
Turk_Translation_1: If the seventeenth amendment had been annulled, Zardari would have never become president.
Turk_Translation_2: Zardari would not have become the President if there had been any intention to do away with the Seventeenth Amendment.
Turk_Translation_3: Had they wanted to repeal the 17th amendment, Zardari would not have become the president.
Turk_Translation_4: If the 17th Amendment had been abolished, Zardari would have never become President.

Urdu: اب تو وہ صدر پرویز سے بھی زیادہ طاقتور شخص ہیں کیونکہ وہ صدر ہونے کیساتھ ساتھ پیپلز پارٹی کے چیئرمین بھی ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: Now he is even more powerful than President Musharraf because he, along with being the president, is also the chair of the People's Party.
Turk_Translation_2: Now he is even stronger than President Pervez, because in addition to being President, he is also the Peoples Party Chairperson.
Turk_Translation_3: Now, he is even stronger than President Pervez because he is the President and the chairman of the Peoples Party simultaneously.
Turk_Translation_4: Now he is more powerful than Pervez Musharraf because he is not only the President but also the Chairman of People's Party.

Urdu: جب تک وہ صدر ہیں سترہویں ترمیم قائم ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: As long as he is president, the seventeenth amendment will remain in place.
Turk_Translation_2: The Seventeenth Amendment will stay as long as he is the President.
Turk_Translation_3: As long as he remains the President, the 17th amendment will stand.
Turk_Translation_4: As long as he is the President, the 17th Amendment will remain intact.

Urdu: سیاسی جماعتوں کو سترہویں ترمیم ختم کرنے کیلیے پہلے صدر ذرداری کو ایوان صدارت سے رخصت کرنا پڑے گا۔
Turk_Translation_1: To get rid of the seventeenth amendment, political parties will first have to get President Zardari out of the presidential house.
Turk_Translation_2: Before eliminating the Seventeenth Amendment, the political parties will have to make President Zardari say goodbye to the President House.
Turk_Translation_3: Before repealing the 17th amendment, the political parties will have to banish President Zardari from the presidential palace.
Turk_Translation_4: To abolish the 17th Amendment, political parties will have to remove President Zardari from the Presidential House first.

Urdu: ایسا نہ ایم کیو ایم چاہتی ہے اور نہ دوسری جماعتیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: This is something neither MQM nor the other parties wants.
Turk_Translation_2: Neither MQM nor other parties want this.
Turk_Translation_3: Neither MQM wants so nor do the other parties.
Turk_Translation_4: Neither the MQM nor other parties wants it.

Urdu: ہمارے خاندان کے اکثر بزرگ مزدور طبقے سے تعلق رکھتے تھے
Turk_Translation_1: Most of the elders of my family belong to the working class.
Turk_Translation_2: The majority of the elders in my family belonged to the labor class
Turk_Translation_3: Most of the elders of my family belonged to labor class
Turk_Translation_4: Most of our ancestors belonged to the labor class,

Urdu: اور جب بچپن میں ہم اپنے چچا، ماموں وغیرہ کو دیہاڑی لگاتے دیکھتے تو دل میں یہی خواہش پیدا ہوتی کہ اللہ ہمیں جسمانی مشقت والی مزدوری سے بچانا۔
Turk_Translation_1: When I used to see my paternal and maternal uncles and the rest of them working for daily wages, I used to pray in my heart that God would save me from such physically rigorous labor.
Turk_Translation_2: and when we used to see our paternal and maternal uncles doing the job of a daily laborer, a wish in our heart always prompted us to request Allah to keep us away from the work involving physical labor.
Turk_Translation_3: and when in my childhood I used to watch my paternal and maternal uncles doing menial labor, I used to pray to God to spare me from such physical hardship.
Turk_Translation_4: and in our childhood, when we used to see our uncles and maternal uncles selling things on handcarts, we would pray to Allah to save us from physical labor.

Urdu: اس سے بچنے کیلئے ہم نے روزنامہ امروز کے ایڈیٹر کو خط لکھا اور پوچھا کہ ہم میٹرک کے بعد کیا کریں کہ ہمیں جسمانی مشقت نہ کرنی پڑے۔
Turk_Translation_1: To get out of this, I wrote a letter to the editor of the Amroze daily newspaper and asked what I should do after graduation so that I don't have to do hard labor.
Turk_Translation_2: To be saved from this, I wrote a letter to the editor of Daily Imroz asking him what to do after Matric so as to avoid physical labor.
Turk_Translation_3: To avoid this, I wrote a letter to the editor of Daily Imroz and asked him what I should do after matriculation so that I did not have to do hard labor.
Turk_Translation_4: To save us from that, we wrote a letter to the editor of Daily Imroz and asked as to what one should do after Metric to be saved from physical labor.

Urdu: ایڈیٹر نے جواب میں لکھا کہ ڈاکٹر یا انجنئر بن جاؤ اور فلاں فلاں مضامین پکڑ لو۔
Turk_Translation_1: The editor wrote back that I should become a doctor or an engineer or take such-and-such subjects.
Turk_Translation_2: The editor in his reply advised to become a doctor or engineer and suggested the reading of specific subjects.
Turk_Translation_3: The editor replied that I should become doctor or engineer and start studying the respective subjects.
Turk_Translation_4: The editor replied that we should become a doctor or an engineer, and suggested a few subjects.

Urdu: ہمارا رجحان شروع سے ہی انجنئرنگ کی طرف تھا اور ہم نے میٹرک میں بھی بیالوجی کی بجائے ٹیکنیکل ڈرائنگ ہی پڑھی۔
Turk_Translation_1: My inclination had always been towards engineering, and I had even taken technical drawing in school instead of biology.
Turk_Translation_2: From the beginning I was interested in engineering, that is why I studied technical drawing instead of biology.
Turk_Translation_3: From the beginning, I was inclined towards engineering and in the matriculation I had studied Technical Drawing instead of Biology.
Turk_Translation_4: As it is, we were interested in engineering, and we passed our Metric exams in technical drawing, not biology.

Urdu: لیکن ایف ایس سی میں داخلے کے وقت بڑے بھائی نے مجبور کیا کہ ہم میڈیکل میں ایف ایس سی کر کے ڈاکٹر بنیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: But at the time of the F. Sc. admissions, my older brother forced me to do my F. Sc. in medicine and become a doctor.
Turk_Translation_2: But at the time of admission in F.Sc., my elder brother forced me to become a doctor by doing F.Sc. in pre-medical.
Turk_Translation_3: But at the time of admission in F.Sc., my elder brother forced me to do F.Sc. in pre-medical and become a doctor.
Turk_Translation_4: But when we went to take admission in FSC, my elder brother forced us to take admission in medical FSC and become a doctor.

Urdu: ہم نے بمشکل ایک ماہ ہی بیالوجی پڑھی اور جب کچھ بھی پلے نہ پڑا تو اس کے بدلے حساب کا مضمون لے لیا۔
Turk_Translation_1: I studied biology with difficulty for a month, but when I couldn't make heads or tails of it, I changed the subject and took math instead.
Turk_Translation_2: I barely studied biology for a month, but, being unable to understand it, opted to take up mathematics.
Turk_Translation_3: I studied Biology hardly for one month and when I could not understand a word of it, I exchanged it for Mathematics.
Turk_Translation_4: We hardly studied biology for a month, and when we couldn't understand, we exchanged it for mathematics.

Urdu: یعنی جسمانی مشقت سے ڈر نے ہمیں انجنئر بنا دیا اور اب ہم اپنے خاندان کے بہت سے ہمجولوں میں اچھی پوزیشن پر ہیں جس پر ہم خدا کا ہر وقت شکر ادا کرتے رہتے ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: It means the dread of physical labor made me an engineer and now I have a better job than most of my peers in the family, for which I constantly thank God.
Turk_Translation_2: This means that the fear of physical labor helped me to become an engineer, and now among the family members of the same age group, I am in a comparatively better position for which I am always thankful to God.
Turk_Translation_3: I mean the fear of menial labor made an engineer of me and now I am at a very good position among many of my peers and am always thankful to God for this blessing.
Turk_Translation_4: That means, fear from physical labor had made us engineers, and now we are in a much better position in our family and we thank Allah for that.

Urdu: یہ بات ہمیں اس وقت یاد آئی جب ہم اپنے دو جوان بیٹوں کیساتھ پرانے گھر کے قالین اٹھانے کی کوشش کر رہے تھے۔
Turk_Translation_1: I was reminded of this when I was trying to lift a carpet with our two young sons at our old home.
Turk_Translation_2: This story came to my mind at a time when I, along with my two young sons, was trying to take away the carpets of our old house.
Turk_Translation_3: I was reminded of this when I was trying to lift the carpets from my old home with the help of my two young sons.
Turk_Translation_4: We realized this while we were laying a carpet in our old house with our two young sons.

Urdu: ابھی کام کرتے آدھا گھنٹہ بھی نہیں ہوا تھا کہ چھوٹا بیٹا بولا “ڈیڈ لگتا ہےمیں اس کام کیلیے پیدا نہیں ہوا”۔
Turk_Translation_1: Not even half an hour had passed when my younger son said, "Dad, looks like I wasn't made to do this kind of work."
Turk_Translation_2: Hardly half an hour had passed after we started doing this job when my younger son said, "Dad! It seems as if I have not been created for this job."
Turk_Translation_3: We were not even half an hour into the work when the younger son said, "Dad, I think I was not born to do this work".
Turk_Translation_4: We were into the work for about half an hour when my younger son said, "Dad, we are not born to do this it seems."

Urdu: ہم نے کہا اگر یہ سچ ہے تو پھر ہماری طرح خوب پڑھو اور جسمانی مشقت سے جان چھڑا لو۔
Turk_Translation_1: I said, "If this is true, then study hard like me and save yourself from having to do hard labor."
Turk_Translation_2: I said if it is true, then work as hard with your study as I did, and then you will get rid of physical labor.
Turk_Translation_3: I said if this were true then he should study diligently like me and get rid of the menial labor.
Turk_Translation_4: We said, "If it is true, then study hard like us and keep away from physical labor."

Urdu: بیٹا کہنے لگا پڑھ تو میں رہا ہوں اور پڑھ بھی جاؤں گا مگر یہ کام میرے سے نہیں ہوتا۔
Turk_Translation_1: My son said, "I am studying and I'll keep doing it, but I can't do this work."
Turk_Translation_2: My son replied that I am studying and will complete it too, but I cannot do this work.
Turk_Translation_3: The son said that he was studying and would complete his studies but he could not do that kind of work.
Turk_Translation_4: The son said, "I am studying and will study but I cannot do this work."

Urdu: جیسے تیسے ہم تینوں نے تین گھنٹے میں وہ کام ختم کیا اور گھر لوٹ آئے۔
Turk_Translation_1: We got the job done as best we could in three hours and returned home.
Turk_Translation_2: All three of us finished this job by hook or by crook in three hours and returned home.
Turk_Translation_3: Somehow, the three of us completed that work in three hours and returned home.
Turk_Translation_4: We finished that work somehow in three hours.

Urdu: کہنے کا مطلب یہ ہے کہ آدمی اگر منزل کا تعین کر لے چاہے اس کے پیچھے جو بھی وجہ کارفرما ہو تو کوئی اسے منزل پانے سے نہیں روک سکتا۔
Turk_Translation_1: The point is that if a man sets his sights on something, whatever his reason is behind that, nothing can stop him from getting what he wants.
Turk_Translation_2: The purpose of telling this story is that if a person has selected his destination with whatever background reasons, no one can stop him from reaching his destination.
Turk_Translation_3: The purpose of narrating this is if one specifies a goal, for whatever reason may there be, nothing could stop him from achieving his goal.
Turk_Translation_4: It is meant to say that if a man decides his destination, no matter what comes his way, no one can stop him from reaching there.

Urdu: ہاں اگر آپ کو پتہ ہی نہیں ہے کہ کرنا کیا ہے تو پھر آپ کا اللہ ہی حافظ ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: But if you don't even know what you want to do, only Allah can save you.
Turk_Translation_2: Well if you don't know what to do, then it will be very hard to succeed.
Turk_Translation_3: And well, if you do not know what you want to do, then only God is your savior.
Turk_Translation_4: Yes, if you don't know what to do then only Allah can save you.

Urdu: کہتے ہیں کہ مرے ہوئے کو برا مت کہو مگر کیا کریں ہمیں بینظیر کی پہلی برسی پر بھِی ان میں برائیاں ہی نظر آتی ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: They say not to say bad things about the dead, but what should we do - we see nothing but Benazir's misdeeds even a year after she died.
Turk_Translation_2: It is said that those who have died should not be blamed, but what should be done when we only see faults in Benazir, even at her first death anniversary.
Turk_Translation_3: It is said that we should not speak ill of the deceased but what can we do. Even on the first death anniversary of Benazir, we can only remember her shortcomings.
Turk_Translation_4: It is said that one should not speak ill of the dead, but what could one do when only bad things are seen on the first anniversary of the death of Benazeer?

Urdu: بینظیر نے اپنے مفاد کی خاطر آزادی کی جنگ لڑنے والے سکھوں کی لسٹ بھارت کو مہیا کر کے ایک طرف سکھوں کی تحریک آزادی کو کچل دیا اور دوسری طرف بھارت کو پنجاب کی تحریک دبانے کے بعد کشمیر میں پوری توجہ مرکوز کرنے کا موقع فراہم کیا۔
Turk_Translation_1: For the sake of her own interests, Benazir provided India a list of names of the Sikhs who were fighting for their independence, whereby on the one hand she crushed their independence movement, and on the other she gave India the opportunity to suppress the Punjab movement and focus all its attention on Kashmir.
Turk_Translation_2: Just to safeguard her own interests, Benazir provided the list of Sikh freedom fighters to India and thus on one hand crushed the independence movement of Sikhs and on the other hand allowed India an opportunity to pay full attention to Kashmir after having suppressed the movement in Punjab.
Turk_Translation_3: On the one hand, she crushed the independence movement of the Sikhs by providing the list of Sikh freedom fighters to India for the sake of her interests, and on the other hand she provided India with the chance to focus on Kashmir after crushing the movement in the Punjab.
Turk_Translation_4: On the one hand, Benazeer had arranged the list of Sikhs who were fighting for their freedom in India, and suppressed their movement, and on the other hand, she had given India a chance after suppressing the Punjab movement in order to concentrate on Kashmir.

Urdu: بینطیر اور نواز شریف کی اقتدار کی رشہ کشی تاریخ کا حصہ ہے جس نے ملک کو کئِ سال پیچھے کی طرف دھکیل دیا۔
Turk_Translation_1: It was Benazir and Nawaz Sharif's tug-of-war for power that set the country many years behind.
Turk_Translation_2: The power tussle between Benazir and Nawaz Sharif is a part of history that pushed the country several years back.
Turk_Translation_3: Benazir and Nawaz Sharif's scramble for power which plunged the country many years back is recorded in history.
Turk_Translation_4: The rift of power between Benazeer and Nawaz Shareef is a part of history that has pushed the country many years back.

Urdu: بینظیر نے جلاوطنی کے دوران کشمیر اور ایٹمی پروگرام پر منفی بیانات کا سلسلہ جاری رکھا۔
Turk_Translation_1: Benazir, during her exile, continued to make negative statements about Kashmir and the atomic program.
Turk_Translation_2: During the period of her exile, Benazir continued to issue negative statements about Kashmir and the atomic program.
Turk_Translation_3: Benazir continued the streak of negative statements on Kashmir and the nuclear program during her exile.
Turk_Translation_4: During her banishment, Benazeer continued to give statements against Kashmir and the nuclear program.

Urdu: بینظیر نے نواز شریف کیساتھ لندن معاہدے کی خلاف ورزی کرتے ہوئے جنرل مشرف کیساتھ ڈیل کر لی۔
Turk_Translation_1: Violating the London agreement she had made with Nawaz Sharif, Benazir made a deal with General Musharraf.
Turk_Translation_2: Violating the agreement signed with Nawaz Sharif in London, Benazir entered into a deal with General Musharraf.
Turk_Translation_3: In violation of the London accord with Nawaz Sharif, Benazir struck a deal with General Musharraf.
Turk_Translation_4: Benazeer had dealt with General Musharraf, dishonoring his agreement with Nawaz Shareef in London.

Urdu: بینظیر نے اپنے دور اقتدار میں اپنے خاوند کو کھل کر پیسہ کمانے کا موقع دیا اور اسی وجہ سے وہ مسٹر ٹین پرسینٹ کہلائے
Turk_Translation_1: Benazir, during her time in office, freely gave her husband the opportunity to make money, and this is why he was called Mr. Ten Percent.
Turk_Translation_2: While in power, Benazir provided her husband with an opportunity to earn money in whatever ways he could, and this is why he was named as Mr. ten percent.
Turk_Translation_3: During her reign, she allowed her husband to openly amass wealth and for this reason, he was called Mr. Ten Percent
Turk_Translation_4: Benazeer, during his tenure, allowed her husband to earn much money. This has earned him the name of Mr. Ten Percent.

Urdu: بینظیر کے دور میں اس کا بھائی قتل ہوا اور جس کے قاتل ابھِی تک سزا سے بچے ہوئے ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: During Benazir's time, her brother was murdered and his murderers have still not been punished.
Turk_Translation_2: While Benazir was in power her brother was murdered, but his killers are still safe from punishment.
Turk_Translation_3: During Benazir's reign, her brother was killed and his killers have not yet been punished.
Turk_Translation_4: Her brother was killed when she was in power, and his assassins are still at large.

Urdu: بینظیر نے عورت ہونے کے باوجود عورتوں کے حقوق کی جنگ لڑنے سے گریز کیا۔
Turk_Translation_1: Despite being a woman herself, Benazir avoided fighting for women's rights.
Turk_Translation_2: Despite being a woman, Benazir avoided fighting for the rights of women.
Turk_Translation_3: Although she was a woman, Benazir avoided the fight for woman's rights.
Turk_Translation_4: Being a woman, Benazeer never raised her voice about women's rights.

Urdu: جس طرح بینظیر نے اپنے والد کی لاش پر سیاست کی اسی طرح اب ان کے رنڈوے خاوند ان کی لاش پر سیاست کر رہے ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: In the same way Benazir thrived as a politician because of her father's death, her widowed husband is now thriving as a politician because of hers.
Turk_Translation_2: Just as Benazir did politics on the dead body of her father, in a similar style her widowed husband is doing politics on her dead body.
Turk_Translation_3: Just as Benazir played her politics over her father's corpse, similarly her widower husband is now playing his politics over her corpse.
Turk_Translation_4: The way Benazeer created her politics on her father's dead body, in the same way her widower husband is playing politics on her dead body.

Urdu: بینظیر کو دو دفعہ حکومت ملی مگر وہ اپنے والد کے سیاسی قتل کے مجرموں کو سزا تو کیا ان کیخلاف مقدمہ بھی درج نہ کرا سکیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: Benazir got control of the government twice, but she couldn't even file a case against those responsible for her father's political murder, let alone get them punished.
Turk_Translation_2: Benazir came into power twice, but not to talk of giving punishment to those involved in the political murder of her father, she even failed to get a case registered against them.
Turk_Translation_3: Benazir won the government twice but, punishment aside, she could not even get a case registered against the political murderers of her father.
Turk_Translation_4: Benazeer came to power twice, but she could not arrest the political killers of her father, and could not even initiate a case against them.

Urdu: مشرقی پاکستان کو ہم سے الگ ہوئے سینتیس سال ہو گئے اور ہمارے عوام اور حکمرانوں کی بے حسی کی انتہا دیکھیں کہ کسی نے اس دن نہ سوگ منایا اور نہ اپنی غلطیوں پر ماتم کیا۔
Turk_Translation_1: It has been 37 years since East Pakistan separated from us, but look at the insensitivity of our people and our rulers - we neither mourned on this day nor lamented our mistakes.
Turk_Translation_2: Thirty-seven years have passed since the separation of East Pakistan from us, and look at the extreme of apathy that our public and rulers have demonstrated by neither mourning nor showing any regrets for their mistakes on this day.
Turk_Translation_3: It has been 37 years since the East Pakistan seceded. And look at the extent of the insensitivity of our people and the rulers that none of them either mourn or repent over their mistakes.
Turk_Translation_4: Thirty-seven years had passed when East Pakistan broke from us, and look at the apathy of our people and leaders that no one even feels sad about it, and no one is beating his chest over a mistake of our own.

Urdu: ہونا تو یہ چاہیے تھا کہ ہم سولہ دسمبر والے دن کو عبرت کے طور پر مناتے اور اس طرح کی تدابیر کرتے کہ ایسا حادثہ دوبارہ وقوع پذیر نہ ہو۔
Turk_Translation_1: What we should have done was to commemorate December 16 as a lesson and come up with the kinds of strategies that could prevent such a misfortune from recurring.
Turk_Translation_2: We should have celebrated 16 December as a day of admonition and taken measures to prevent the reoccurrence of similar happenings.
Turk_Translation_3: The proper course of action should have been to commemorate December 16 as a day of admonition and we should have made such moves that such an accident would not happen again.
Turk_Translation_4: We should have remembered December 16 as an example and made sure that such things don't happen again.

Urdu: اس دن ہم بنگلہ دیش کے لوگوں کو خیرسگالی کے پیغامات بھیجتے اور انہیں دوبارھ اپنےقریب لانے کی کوشش کرتے۔
Turk_Translation_1: We should have sent goodwill messages to the people of Bangladesh on this day and tried to bring them close to us again.
Turk_Translation_2: We should have sent the messages of goodwill on this day to the people of Bangladesh and tried to bring them closer to us again.
Turk_Translation_3: We should have sent goodwill messages to the people of Bangladesh and tried to bring them closer to us again.
Turk_Translation_4: On that day, we could send messages of prosperity to the people of Bangladesh and try again to bring them closer.

Urdu: حکمران حمودالرحمن کمیشن کی فائل کو کھولتے اور اس میں مشرقی پاکستان کی علیحدگی کی وجوہات پر غور کرتے۔
Turk_Translation_1: Rulers should have opened the Hamood-ur-Rehman Commission's file and deliberated on the reasons for East Pakistan's separation.
Turk_Translation_2: Rulers should have opened the file of the Hamood-ur-Rahman Commission and pondered upon the reasons for separation of East Pakistan.
Turk_Translation_3: The rulers should have opened the Hamood-ur-Rehman Commission's Report and considered the reasons that led to the secession of East Pakistan.
Turk_Translation_4: Rulers would open Mehmoodurrahman's files and look into the reasons why Eastern Pakistan broke away.

Urdu: بنگلہ دیش میں پھنسے ہوئے بہاریوں کو واپس لانے کی تدبیر کرتے اور ان کی حوصلہ افزائی کیلیے انہیں تحائف بھیجتے۔
Turk_Translation_1: They should have come up with a strategy for bringing back the Biharis stuck in Bangladesh, and sent them gifts to encourage them.
Turk_Translation_2: We should have taken measures to bring back the stranded Biharis in Bangladesh and sent them gifts for encouragement.
Turk_Translation_3: They should have thought about some way to bring back the Biharis stranded in Bangladesh and sent them gifts for encouragement.
Turk_Translation_4: Efforts should have been made to bring back the Biharis who are still strangled in Bangladesh and would have sent gifts to keep their spirits high.

Urdu: لیکن ہم بے حس ہو چکے ہیں ہمارے پڑوس میں کوئی مر جائے ہمیں اس کی اب اطلاع نہیں ہوتی۔
Turk_Translation_1: But we have become insensitive. If someone dies in our neighborhood, we do not even find out about it.
Turk_Translation_2: But we have turned so senseless that if someone dies in our neighborhood, we have no information about this.
Turk_Translation_3: But we have become insensitive. If someone dies next door, we do not get the information now.
Turk_Translation_4: But we have become insensitive; if someone dies in our neighborhood, we don't know it.

Urdu: ہمیں اپنے بہن بھائیوں کی فکر نہیں رہی کیونکہ ہم خودغرض ہو چکے ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: We don't care about our sisters and brothers anymore because we've become selfish.
Turk_Translation_2: We don't have any concerns for our sisters and brothers because we have become selfish.
Turk_Translation_3: We no more care for our brothers and sisters because we have become selfish.
Turk_Translation_4: We don't care for our brothers and sisters because we have become selfish.

Urdu: بڑے سے بڑا سانحہ گزر جائے ہم اگلے دن پھر اپنے معمولات زندگی میں کھو جاتے ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: Even if a great tragedy occurs, the next day we get tied up in our day-to-day affairs.
Turk_Translation_2: Even after the occurrence of the greatest of tragedies, we get deeply occupied the next day with the usual affairs of life.
Turk_Translation_3: No matter how great a tragedy may befall us, we get back to business the next day.
Turk_Translation_4: Regardless of what big tragedy occurs, we go about our lives normally the following day.

Urdu: کاش جس طرح مشرقی اور مغربی جرمنی دوبارہ ایک ہو گئے اسی طرح مشرقی اور مغربی پاکستان بھی دوبارہ ایک ہو سکتے۔
Turk_Translation_1: I wish East and West Pakistan could reunite the same way that East and West Germany did.
Turk_Translation_2: Would that as East and West Germany became united again, in a similar style East and West Pakistan too had become united again.
Turk_Translation_3: As the East and West Germany have unified, would that East and West Pakistan could unify once again.
Turk_Translation_4: The way East and West Germany became one, I wish East and West Pakistan would become one again.

Urdu: ہم دوبارہ ایک ہو سکتے ہیں اگر دونوں ایک دوسرے کیلیے قربانی ديں اور خودغرضی کے خول سے باہر نکل آئیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: We can be one again if both make sacrifices for each other and break out of the shell of selfishness.
Turk_Translation_2: We can become united again if we sacrifice for each other and get out of the shell of selfishness.
Turk_Translation_3: We can again unify if both sacrifice for each other and come out of the shell of selfishness.
Turk_Translation_4: We can once again become one if both sacrifice for each other and come out of the shell of selfishness.

Urdu: لیکن یہ خواہش مستقبل قریب میں پوری ہوتی نظر نہیں آتی۔
Turk_Translation_1: But it doesn't look like this wish will be fulfilled anytime in the near future.
Turk_Translation_2: But this desire is not likely to be fulfilled in the near future.
Turk_Translation_3: But I do not see this wish coming true in the near future.
Turk_Translation_4: But this desire doesn't seem likely to be fulfilled in the near future.

Urdu: آج جب خبروں میں بتایا گیا کہ امریکی ریاست الی نوائے کا گورنر کرپشن چارجز میں گرفتار کر لیا گیا
Turk_Translation_1: Today, when it was stated in the news that the governor of the American state of Illinois was arrested on charges of corruption
Turk_Translation_2: News came in today's broadcast saying that the Governor of the State of Illinois in the United States has been arrested for corruption charges.
Turk_Translation_3: When it was reported in the news today that the Governor of the American state Illinois had been arrested on corruption charges
Turk_Translation_4: Today's news revealed that the Governor of the American state of Illinois has been arrested under corruption charges.

Urdu: اور اسے گورنری سے ہٹانے کیلیے صوبائی کانگریس جلد سے جلد اس کا محاسبہ کرنے کی تیاری کرنے لگ Edit ی ہے تو ہمارے ایک امریکی گورے ساتھی جن کی پاکستان کے حالات پر گہری نظر ہوتی ہے نے ہمیں شیخی بگھارتے ہوئے لکارا کہ دیکھو جمہوریت اسے کہتے ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: and that to take him out of office, the Provincial Congress has started to make preparations to call him to account as soon as possible, one of our white American friends who keeps a close watch on the situation in Pakistan challenged us as he boasted, "See, this is what democracy is."
Turk_Translation_2: To remove him from the governorship, the provincial congress has moved very quickly with the preparation for his accountability. An American white man who keeps a careful eye on Pakistan's affairs boastfully challenged me by citing this example of democracy.
Turk_Translation_3: and as the state congress was preparing for his impeachment at the earliest to remove him from the governorship, a white American friend of mine who keeps a keen eye on the situation in Pakistan bragged to me that this was called democracy.
Turk_Translation_4: Provincial Congress is preparing to hold him accountable and remove him from the post of Governor. One of our American white friends who keeps an eye on the situation in Pakistan challenged us proudly and said, "Look, this is democracy."

Urdu: امریکہ میں بڑے سے بڑا آدمی بھی قانون سے ماورا نہیں ہے
Turk_Translation_1: Not even the most important person in America is above the law.
Turk_Translation_2: In America, even the powerful are not above the law.
Turk_Translation_3: Even the strongest man is not above law in America
Turk_Translation_4: In America, even the biggest man is not above the law,

Urdu: اور ایک تمہارا ملک پاکستان ہے جس کا صدر بھی کرپشن چارجز ڈراپ کرانے کے بعد بنا ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: And then we have your country, Pakistan, where even the president came into office only after getting the corruption charges dropped.
Turk_Translation_2: And in your country Pakistan, even the president came into power after getting corruption charges dropped against himself.
Turk_Translation_3: and then there is your country Pakistan whose President has taken office only after getting the corruption charges against him dropped.
Turk_Translation_4: and there is your country Pakistan whose President got his charges dropped to become the President.

Urdu: ہماری رگ ظرافت پھڑکی اور ہم نے کہا اگر مریکہ میں ایک گورنر گرفتار ہوا ہے تو کیا ہوا، ہمارے پاکستان میں تو راتوں رات وزیراعظم کو گرفتار کر کے ایک بار پھانسی چڑھایا گیا اور دوسری بار ملک بدر کیا گیا۔
Turk_Translation_1: I took it with a sense of humor and said, "So what if one governor was arrested in America? In our Pakistan, the prime minister was arrested and hanged overnight one time, and another one was sent into exile.
Turk_Translation_2: I responded in a joking way, saying that the arrest of a governor in America is totally worthless if compared with Pakistan, where one prime minister was arrested and hanged and another was exiled in no time.
Turk_Translation_3: Our sense of humor was stirred and we replied that the arrest of one Governor in America was not a big deal since in our country one prime minister was arrested and hanged overnight and the other one was exiled in no time.
Turk_Translation_4: My witty nature did not let me take a back seat, so I said, so what if one governor is arrested in America? In our Pakistan, one Prime Minister was arrested in the night to be hanged and other was banished.

Urdu: بتاؤ کبھی امریکہ میں ایسا ہوا؟
Turk_Translation_1: Tell me, did this ever happen in America?"
Turk_Translation_2: Tell me if this has even happened in America.
Turk_Translation_3: Tell us if such a thing had ever happened in America?
Turk_Translation_4: Tell me if this has ever happened in America?

Urdu: پاکستان نے تو ملک کا قانون توڑنے والے کو گارڈ آف آنر کیساتھ صدارتی ایوان سے رخصت کیا، بتاؤ کیا امریکہ میں کبھی ایسا ہوا؟
Turk_Translation_1: Pakistan gave a guard of honor to a president who broke the national law as he left his house. Tell me, did this ever happen in America?
Turk_Translation_2: In Pakistan, the one who broke the constitution was offered a guard of honor before his departure from the presidential palace; tell me if this has ever happened in America?
Turk_Translation_3: Pakistan saw off the President from the presidential palace with guard of honor who had dismissed the constitution of the country? Tell us if it had ever happened in America?
Turk_Translation_4: Pakistan had awarded the badge of honor to a law breaker before his departure from the presidential house; tell me if this has ever happened in America?

Urdu: پاکستان میں چیف جسٹس کو ایسا معطل کیا گیا کہ عوامی سپورٹ ہونے کے باوجود وہ ابھی تک بحال نہیں ہو سکا، کیا امریکہ میں ایسا ہوا؟
Turk_Translation_1: In Pakistan, the chief justice was suspended in such a way that, despite having popular support, he still has not been reinstated. Did this ever happen in America?
Turk_Translation_2: In Pakistan, the Chief Justice was suspended, and despite public support, he has not been reinstated up to now; has this happened in America?
Turk_Translation_3: In Pakistan, the Chief Justice was dismissed in such a way that despite having public support he has not yet been reinstated. Has it happened in America?
Turk_Translation_4: In Pakistan, the Chief Justice was removed, and could not be reinstated even with popular support. Has this ever happened in America?

Urdu: پاکستان میں جعلی ڈگری ہولڈر کو وزیرصحت بنایا گیا، کیا امریکہ میں ایسا ہوا؟
Turk_Translation_1: The holder of a counterfeit degree was made the Minister of Health in Pakistan. Did this ever happen in America?
Turk_Translation_2: In Pakistan, a fake degree holder was made the minister for health, has this happened in America?
Turk_Translation_3: A fake degree holder was appointed health minister in Pakistan. Did it ever happen in America?
Turk_Translation_4: In Pakistan, a fake degree holder was made the Minister of Health. Has this ever happened in America?

Urdu: یہ سن کر امریکی بیچارہ ہنس ہنس کر ادھ موا ہو گیا اور ساتھ ہی اپنی ہار بھی مان گیا۔
Turk_Translation_1: When he heard this, the poor American laughed hysterically as he accepted his defeat.
Turk_Translation_2: After listening to this, the poor American laughed too much and accepted his defeat.
Turk_Translation_3: The poor American laughed himself out and conceded his defeat.
Turk_Translation_4: Hearing this, the American fell down laughing and accepted his defeat.

Urdu: اس تصویر میں صدر زرداری چاروں طرف سے امریکیوں میں گھرے ہونے کے باوجود مسکرا رہے ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: In this photograph, President Zardari is smiling even though he is surrounded on all four sides by Americans.
Turk_Translation_2: Despite being surrounded by the Americans from all four sides, President Zardari is still smiling in this picture.
Turk_Translation_3: In this photograph, despite being surrounded on all sides by the Americans, President Zardari is smiling.
Turk_Translation_4: In this picture, President Zardari is smiling even when he is surrounded by Americans.

Urdu: ان کی مسکراہٹ سے لگتا ہے
Turk_Translation_1: He is smiling as if
Turk_Translation_2: His smile is an indication
Turk_Translation_3: It appears from his smile
Turk_Translation_4: His smile indicates

Urdu: وہ سمجھ رہے ہیں کہ امریکہ ان کی حکومت کیساتھ ہے مگر وہ یہ بھول رہے ہیں کہ یہی لوگ ایک سال قبل پرویز مشرف کیساتھ تھے۔
Turk_Translation_1: he thinks that America is in favor of his government, but he is forgetting that a year ago the same people were in favor of Pervez Musharraf.
Turk_Translation_2: of his feeling that America is backing his government, but he is forgetting that a year ago the same people were supporting Pervez Musharraf.
Turk_Translation_3: as if he thinks that America is with his government but he is forgetting that these same people were with Pervez Musharraf a year ago.
Turk_Translation_4: that he thinks that America is with his government, but perhaps he forgot that these are the same people who were with Parvez Musharraf a year ago.

Urdu: یہ تصویر تو ایسے اتروائی گئی ہے جیسے کسی خاندان کی ہو۔
Turk_Translation_1: This photograph has been taken just like a family picture.
Turk_Translation_2: The picture has been portrayed as if it is a family picture.
Turk_Translation_3: This photograph has been posed for as if it were a family photo.
Turk_Translation_4: This picture was taken as if it is a family portrait.

Urdu: اس سے قبل کبھی اس طرح کی فوٹو اخبارات میں نہیں چھپی یعنی ایک صدر کیساتھ تین تین امریکی اہلکار۔
Turk_Translation_1: Before this, such a photograph with one president and six American officials was never allowed to be published.
Turk_Translation_2: This type of picture, showing three American delegates with a president, has not been published in the newspapers before.
Turk_Translation_3: Never has such a photo been published in a newspaper before this. That is one president with three American officials.
Turk_Translation_4: There was no such picture, a President with three American officials published in the newspapers earlier.

Urdu: لگتا ہے امریکہ کا کام پاکستان میں بڑھ گیا ہے اور اب ایک سے زیادہ کارندوں کو مل کر اسے نپٹانا پڑ رہا ہے یا پھر ان کا نئے غلام پر وہ بھروسہ نہیں رہا جو اس سے پہلے والے پر تھا۔
Turk_Translation_1: It seems as if America's work in Pakistan has increased so much that not just one official can take care of it, they have to team up - either that or they don't trust their new slave the way they trusted the one before him.
Turk_Translation_2: It seems the American responsibility has increased in Pakistan and now it needs more than one employee to carry it out, or the level of their trust on the new slave is not as high as was for the previous one.
Turk_Translation_3: It seems as if America's workload has increased in Pakistan and she has to do it with more than one workers. Or it may be so that they don't trust the new slave as much as they did the previous one.
Turk_Translation_4: It seems the work for America in Pakistan has increased and they want more than one person to finish it, or they do not trust this slave more than they believed the earlier one.

Urdu: یہ بھی ہو سکتا ہے صدر زرداری کی وعدہ خلافی کی مشہوری کو مدںظر رکھتے ہوئے یہ بندوبست کیا گیا ہو۔
Turk_Translation_1: It could also be that this arrangement was made while keeping in mind President Zardari's notoriety for going back on his promises.
Turk_Translation_2: It may also be possible that, keeping in view President Zardari's reputation of backtracking, they had to make this arrangement.
Turk_Translation_3: It is also possible that this arrangement had been made keeping in view the notoriety of President Zardari's reneging.
Turk_Translation_4: It is also possible that Zardari's promise-breaking stories have reached them, and so they made an allowance for that.

Urdu: اگر کوئی سمجھدار حکمران ہوتا تو کم از کم اس تصویر میں اپنے دانت نہ دکھاتا اور اس کے چہرے پر غلامی کے طوق کی شرمندگی ضرور عیاں ہوتی۔
Turk_Translation_1: Had it been some sensible ruler, at least he would not have sported such a smile in the photograph; at least there would have been some shame on his face because of the collar of slavery he's wearing.
Turk_Translation_2: If there has been a sensible leader, he would at least have avoided putting his teeth on show and, his face would obviously have exhibited the shame of slavery.
Turk_Translation_3: Had there been some wise ruler, he would have not given a smile in this photograph and the shame over the yoke of slavery would have been visible on his face.
Turk_Translation_4: A sincere ruler would not have shown his teeth in the picture, and he would at least have a little shame on his face for being a slave.

Urdu: اگر جمہوریت کا اصول اس تصویر پر لاگو کیا جائے تو صدر زرداری اقلیت میں ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: If the principle of democracy is applied to this photograph, President Zardari is in the minority.
Turk_Translation_2: If the principle of democracy is applied to this picture, then President Zardari is in the minority.
Turk_Translation_3: If the principle of democracy is applied to this photograph, President Zardari would find himself in the minority.
Turk_Translation_4: If one applies the rules of democracy to this picture, Zardari is in the minority.

Urdu: جمہوریت کے مطابق اکثریت ہی ملک کی حکمران ہوتی ہے اور وہ کون ہے یہ تصویر بول رہی ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: In a democracy, only a majority rules the country, and this photograph shows who the majority is.
Turk_Translation_2: In accordance with democracy, only the majority has a government in the country, and who is that this picture is telling.
Turk_Translation_3: According to the democracy, only majority rules the country and the photograph tells who is in majority.
Turk_Translation_4: In a democracy, majority rules the country. And who is a majority? The picture speaks a lot about it.

Urdu: جنت نظیر سوات کو پاکستان کا سویٹزرلینڈ بھی کہا جاتا ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: The heavenly Swat is also called the Switzerland of Pakistan.
Turk_Translation_2: The paradise like Sawat is also called Pakistan's Switzerland.
Turk_Translation_3: The heavenly Swat is also called the Switzerland of Pakistan.
Turk_Translation_4: Heavenly Swat is called the Switzerland of Pakistan.

Urdu: اب تک کی حکومتی حکمت عملی کے مطابق طاقت کے ساتھ ساتھ مزاکرات کئے جا رہے ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: Until now, according to government strategy, negotiations are being held along with the use of power.
Turk_Translation_2: So far, as per governmental strategy, negotiations are continuing along with the use of force.
Turk_Translation_3: According to the government strategy so far, the talks are being conducted along with the use of force.
Turk_Translation_4: As per the government's strategy, talks are in progress at the same time force is also being used.

Urdu: لیکن طاقت کا استمال طالباں کی طاقت بڑھانے اور عوام میں ان کے لئے ہمدردی پیدا کرنے کے علاوہ کچھ فائدا نہیں دے رہا۔
Turk_Translation_1: But the use of force is having no benefit other than to increase the strength of the Taliban and create sympathy for them among the people.
Turk_Translation_2: But the use of force is not giving any paybacks, except helping to increase the Taliban's strength and creating sympathies for them among the public.
Turk_Translation_3: But the use of force has been of no use except further enhancing the Taliban's power and creating sympathy for them among the public.
Turk_Translation_4: But the use of force is only increasing the power of the Taliban; there is a sympathy among the people for them, but there is no benefit beyond it.

Urdu: ضرورت اس امر کی ہے کہ طاقت کے استمال کی جگہ حکومت اس مثلے کی وجوہات ختم کرے۔
Turk_Translation_1: There is a need for the government to eliminate the reasons for this problem instead of using force.
Turk_Translation_2: What is needed is that instead of using force, the government should eliminate the causes of this problem.
Turk_Translation_3: It is needed that the government addresses the causes of the problem rather than using the force.
Turk_Translation_4: The need of the hour is to use no force, but to finish the root cause of it.

Urdu: وجوہات کے خاتمے سے فضل اللہ اور طالبان خود بہ خود ختم ہو جائیں گے۔
Turk_Translation_1: By eliminating the reasons, Fazlullah and the Taliban will fall apart on their own.
Turk_Translation_2: By eliminating the causes, Fazlullah and the Taliban will be eliminated automatically.
Turk_Translation_3: If the causes are addressed, Fazlullah and the Taliban will automatically vanish.
Turk_Translation_4: If the root cause is ended, people like Fazlullah and the Taliban will be finished on their own.

Urdu: اے این پی حکومت کی جانب سے مجوزا شرعیت بل کا فی حد تک سوات کے مثائیل کے حل کا سبب بنے گا۔
Turk_Translation_1: The Sharia Bill proposed by the ANP government will go a long way to help solve the problems of Swat.
Turk_Translation_2: The Shariah bill proposed by the ANP Government will solve Sawat problems to a greater extent.
Turk_Translation_3: The proposed Shariat bill from the ANP government will, to a great extent, provide the solution to the problems of Swat.
Turk_Translation_4: The proposed Sharia Bill by ANP will solve the problems of Swat to a large extent.

Urdu: مگر شریعت کے نفاظ کے ساتھ ساتھ حکومت کو معاشی مثائیل پر بھی توجہ دینا ہو گی
Turk_Translation_1: But along with enforcing Sharia, the government will also need to focus on the economic problems.
Turk_Translation_2: But along with the enforcement of Shariah, the government shall also side by side have to pay attention to the economic issues
Turk_Translation_3: But along with the implementation of Shariat, the government will have to focus on the economic problems too
Turk_Translation_4: But with the implementation of Sharia law, the government should also pay heed to financial problems.

Urdu: جنرل مشرف کے شروع کےاقدامات سے يہ لگا تھا کہ شايد اس قوم کونا اھل سياست دانوں سے نجات ملے گی ليکن اقتدار کے حوس نے ان کے سارے ارادے بدل ديے
Turk_Translation_1: From the initial steps taken by General Musharraf, it looked like the nation might be rid of incompetent politicians but the lust for power changed all his plans.
Turk_Translation_2: It appeared on the basis of initial steps taken by Musharraf that perhaps this nation will be liberated from incapable politicians, but the lust for power changed all his intentions
Turk_Translation_3: The initial steps taken by General Musharraf suggested that this nation might get rid of the unworthy politicians but the lust for power transformed all his intentions
Turk_Translation_4: The initial steps taken by General Musharraf started to give one a feeling that the nation will now get rid of these inefficient politicians, but his greed for power has changed all of his aspirations.

Urdu: جو بھی اميديں تھيں وہ "وار اف ٹيرر"ميں شموليت سےوہ اپنےاپ کو حقيقت ميں لازوال سمجھنے لگے
Turk_Translation_1: Whatever the hopes were in becoming a part of the "war of terror" he started thinking of himself as truly immortal
Turk_Translation_2: whatever the expectations were, his participation in the 'war on terror' made him think that he has become an invincible man
Turk_Translation_3: whatever the hopes were, after joining the 'war of terror', he actually began to consider himself immortal
Turk_Translation_4: He started to think of himself as invincible after joining "The War On Terror," doing whatever was expected.

Urdu: اور جن اقدامات کی توقع تھی وہ ختم ہوگيی۔
Turk_Translation_1: and the expected steps he would take were disappointed.
Turk_Translation_2: and the measures that were expected from him disappeared.
Turk_Translation_3: and expectations of taking certain steps ended.
Turk_Translation_4: And the measures that were expected, shattered.

Urdu: جيسےہی بش کےدور کا خاتمہ ہونےلگا تو ان کواپنے اقتدار کے خاتمے کی فکر ہونے لگی اور بوکلاہٹ ميں چوروں سے ڈيل کر دی۔
Turk_Translation_1: Just like when Bush's term in office was coming to an end, he started worrying about the end of his power and in the confusion made a deal with thieves.
Turk_Translation_2: As the government of Bush started coming to an end, Musharraf started feeling concerned about the end of his rule and in a state of perturbation he entered into a deal with thieves.
Turk_Translation_3: As the Bush era neared its end, he began to worry about the end of his regime and signed a deal with the thieves in panic.
Turk_Translation_4: As Bush's tenure came to an end, he also became worried about the end of his government and quickly dealt with thieves.

Urdu: جنرل مشرف پھر بھی فوج کو کنٹرول کر سکتے تھے ليکن موجودہ حکومت کو پتہ ہی نہيں کہ کيا ہورہا ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: General Musharraf could still control the army but the current government does not even know what is happening.
Turk_Translation_2: General Musharraf could control the army, but the current government does not know what is going on.
Turk_Translation_3: General Musharraf could nevertheless have controlled the military but the present government does not even know what is happening.
Turk_Translation_4: Even after that, General Musharraf could have controlled the army, but who knows what is happening with the present government?

Urdu: باجوڑ ہو يا سوات فوج ٹيرر کو کنٹرول نہيں کرتی اور بمباری "دشمن"يعنی عوام پر کرتی ہے جانی 'مالی نقصان کے ساتھ ساتھ 'دشمن'کو ذہنی مريض بنا دیے تو دشمن ہم ہی ہوے نہ
Turk_Translation_1: Be it Bajaur or Swat, the army does not control terror and bombs the people, causing physical loss and loss of property, making the "enemy" a mental patient, which means we are the enemy.
Turk_Translation_2: Whether it is Bajur or Sawat, the army cannot control terrorists and resort to shelling on the 'enemy' - i.e. the public - which in addition to resulting in losses to human lives and material also making people psychologically sick; so who is the enemy except us!
Turk_Translation_3: Whether it be Bajaur or Swat, the army does not control the terrorism. And it bombs the 'enemy' i.e. 'the people'. It harms the life and finances of the 'enemy', as well as make them psychotic. That means we are the enemies
Turk_Translation_4: Whether it is Bajod or Swat, the government is not controlling terror, but rather bombarding its "enemies"; this not only damages property, but also makes the "enemy" a mental patient. Then, only we are their enemies.

Urdu: صوبہ سرحد کے شورش زدہ علاقے سوات میں ایک سال سے زائد عرصے سے فوجی کارروائی جاری ہونے کے باوجود حالات بد سے بدتر ہوتے جا رہے ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: In spite of army operations underway for over a year in the Frontier Province's insurgency-ridden area of Swat, the situation has been going from bad to worse.
Turk_Translation_2: In the troubled area of Sawat in the Frontier province, even with the continuing military operations for the last one year, the situation is increasingly becoming worse.
Turk_Translation_3: The conditions are steadily getting worse in the troubled areas of Swat in the Frontier province despite the military operation that has been going on for more than a year.
Turk_Translation_4: One year of army action has passed in the disturbed border province of Swat, and the situation is going from bad to worse.

Urdu: ایک طرف حکومت کی اس علاقے میں رٹ صرف قومی اسمبلی میں مذمتی قرارداد منظور کرنے کی حد تک رہ گئی ہے، اور دوسری طرف طالبان کے غیر قانونی ریڈیو ایف ایم چینل کا اثر و رسوخ سوات میں کہیں زیادہ ہوتا جا رہا ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: On the one hand, the government's writ in this area has been reduced to approving condemnatory resolutions in the National Assembly; on the other, Taliban's illegal FM radio channel's influence seems to be increasing in Swat.
Turk_Translation_2: On one hand, writ of the government in this area is now limited only to passing a condemnation resolution in the National Assembly, whereas on the other hand, the influence of the Taliban's illegal FM radio channel is significantly increasing in Sawat.
Turk_Translation_3: On the one hand, the government's writ in this area has been reduced to passage of a resolution of condemnation in the National Assembly and on the other hand the influence of the illegal FM radio channel of the Taliban has been steadily increasing in Swat.
Turk_Translation_4: On the one hand, the government is limited in this area to repeating to move a condemnation writ in the national assembly, and on the other hand, Taliban's illegal FM Radio is enjoying immense popularity in Swat.

Urdu: تیسری طرف عام شہری اسی میں عافیت سمجھتا ہے کہ اس علاقے میں جس کی عملاً عملداری ہے اسی کی سنی جائے۔
Turk_Translation_1: Thirdly, the common citizen thinks the only way to be safe is to listen to whoever has the power in the area.
Turk_Translation_2: Thirdly, a common man deems it safe to be showing submissiveness to those who are practically in control of this area.
Turk_Translation_3: The third aspect is that the ordinary citizen finds it convenient to obey the person who is ruling the area.
Turk_Translation_4: Thirdly, common citizens find it fit to obey the one who is practically in charge of this area.

Urdu: سوات میں سکیورٹی فورسز کی کارروائی کے دوران تقریباً گن شپ ہیلی کاپٹروں اور توپ خانوں کی بمباری سے کئی شدت پسندوں کی ہلاکت کے دعوے کیے جانتے ہیں، لیکن ان ہلاکتوں کے باوجود طالبان نہ صرف زیادہ مستحکم ہوئے ہیں بلکہ ان کی عملداری ایک اندازے کے مطابق اسی فیصد سوات پر قائم ہوگئی۔
Turk_Translation_1: During the operations in Swat carried out by security forces, it is claimed that gunship helicopters and bombings of arsenals killed many extremists, but in spite of these killings, not only has the Taliban grown stronger - according to one estimate, their control has been established in 80 percent of Swat.
Turk_Translation_2: In Sawat, killing of extremists is claimed as a result of shelling from gunship helicopters and artillery fires during security forces operations, but even with these killings, the Taliban have not only gathered more strength, but, according to an estimate, they are in control of 80% of the Sawat area.
Turk_Translation_3: The claims are made about the deaths of many extremists in Swat by the gunship helicopters and in the artillery fire in the operation being conducted by the security forces. But despite these deaths, not only have the Taliban consolidated even further but according to one estimate, their control has spread to almost eighty percent of Swat.
Turk_Translation_4: In Swat, during the operations of security forces, they claimed to kill ..... fundamentals through their gunship helicopters and cannons, but despite these killings, the Taliban is not only becoming stronger but, according to an estimate, are practically ruling eighty percent of Swat.

Urdu: نتیجہ یہ کہ ایک طرف حکومت اپنی ناکامی ماننے کے لیے تیار نہیں اور دوسری طرف طالبان مستحکم۔
Turk_Translation_1: In conclusion, the government is not ready to accept its failure, and the Taliban is stronger.
Turk_Translation_2: The result is that on one hand, the government is not ready to accept its failures, and on the other hand, the Taliban are strong.
Turk_Translation_3: Consequently, on the one hand the government is not prepared to concede its failure and on the other hand, the Taliban are more stable.
Turk_Translation_4: The result is, while the government is not ready to accept its defeat, the Taliban is well established there.

Urdu: بیچ میں پسا کون، بے چارے شہری۔
Turk_Translation_1: The ones who got stuck in the middle were the poor citizens.
Turk_Translation_2: Who is being crushed in between - the poor citizens!
Turk_Translation_3: And who has been crushed between the two: the ordinary citizens.
Turk_Translation_4: Who is caught between the line of fire? Poor citizens.

Urdu: سوات میں اب کہا جاتا ہے کہ کسی نے پوچھا کہ طالبان کیسے لوگ ہیں تو جواب ملا بہت اچھے کیونکہ وہ دین کے محافظ ہیں اور 'اللہ اور دین کے دشمنوں' کے خلاف لڑتے ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: It is said that someone in Swat asked what kind of people Taliban members are - the answer came that they are very good people because they are protectors of religion and they fight against the "enemies of Allah and religion."
Turk_Translation_2: In Sawat someone asked how are the Taliban? The reply came that they are very good, because they are the custodians of Allah's code of life and are fighting against 'enemies of Allah and the religion of Allah'.
Turk_Translation_3: It is said in Swat now that someone asked what kind of people Taliban were and the reply came that they were very good since they were the guardians of the faith and were fighting the 'enemies of God and religion'.
Turk_Translation_4: In Swat, it is now said, someone asked what kind of people are Taliban. Another answered, very good, because they are the custodians of religion and fight against the 'enemies of Allah and religion.'

Urdu: پھر پوچھا گیا کہ فوج کیسی ہے تو جواب ملا کہ بہت اچھی کیونکہ وہ 'وطن کی حفاظت کرتے ہیں اور ملک کے دشمنوں کے خلاف' لڑتی ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: When asked what the army is like, the answer came that it's very good because it "protects our homeland" and fights against "the country's enemies."
Turk_Translation_2: Another question was asked, how is army? The answer received said very well, because it is 'defending the country and fighting against the enemies of the country'.
Turk_Translation_3: Then they were asked about the army and the reply was that the army was good because it 'guarded the country and fought against the enemies of the state'.
Turk_Translation_4: Again asked, how is the army? Someone answered, very good because they 'defend the country and fight against the enemies of the country.'

Urdu: تو پھر پوچھا گیا کہ دین اور وطن کے دشمن کون ہیں تو جواب ملا ہم شہری۔
Turk_Translation_1: Then when asked who the enemies of religion and our homeland are; the answer came "we the citizens."
Turk_Translation_2: Then it was asked who is the enemy of Allah's Code of life and the country? The reply was "we the public".
Turk_Translation_3: Then it was asked who were the enemies of the religion and the country and the answer came; we, the ordinary citizens.
Turk_Translation_4: Then again asked, who are the enemies of religion and the country? Then came the answer: we, the citizens of this country'.

Urdu: میں حیران ہوں کہ پاکستانی فوج بھارتی فوج کے ساتھ کیسے لڑے گی جو وہ طالبان کے ایک چھوٹے سے گروپ کو کنٹرول نہیں کر سکی۔
Turk_Translation_1: I don't know how the Pakistani army will fight against the Indian army when it could not control a small Taliban group.
Turk_Translation_2: I am surprised how the Pakistan army will fight with the Indian army when it cannot control a small group of Taliban.
Turk_Translation_3: I wonder how Pakistan army will fight against the Indian army when it cannot control a small group of the Taliban.
Turk_Translation_4: I am amazed. If the Pakistan Army cannot control a small group of Taliban, how would it fight a war with India? Army.

Urdu: طالبان کا غیر قانونی طور پر چلنے والا ایف ایم چینل کو ٹریک نہ کرسکے جو کہ میرے خیال میں بہت آسان ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: They could not track the Taliban's illegal FM channel, which I think should be very easy to do.
Turk_Translation_2: They could not track an illegally-run FM Channel of Taliban, which I think is very simple.
Turk_Translation_3: They cannot track down the illegal FM channel which I think is very easy to do.
Turk_Translation_4: They could not even track the illegally operated Taliban FM channel, which I believe is easy to track.

Urdu: لیکن پھر بھی یہ ایف ایم پورے آب و تاب کے ساتھ زہر اگل رہا ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: Even now this FM is spewing its venom with full force.
Turk_Translation_2: But still, it is spreading poisonous propaganda with full might.
Turk_Translation_3: Even then this FM is poisoning the airwaves with full force.
Turk_Translation_4: Even now, this FM channel is spitting fire with great fanfare.

Urdu: بچیوں کے سکولوں۔ کے بعد اب لڑکوں کے سکول تباہ کیے جا رہے ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: After the girls' schools, now the boys' schools are being destroyed.
Turk_Translation_2: After girls schools, boys schools are now being destroyed.
Turk_Translation_3: After the girls schools, the boys schools are now being destroyed.
Turk_Translation_4: Boys' schools are being destroyed after closing down girls' schools.

Urdu: کرفیو لگایا جاتا ہے تاکہ طالبان آسانی سے نقل و حرکت کرسکیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: A curfew is imposed to make it easy for the Taliban to move.
Turk_Translation_2: Curfew is imposed so as to facilitate the movement of Taliban.
Turk_Translation_3: The curfew is imposed so that the Taliban may easily move around.
Turk_Translation_4: A curfew is imposed so that Talibans can move easily from one place to another.

Urdu: آج رات کرفیو کے دوران آٹھ ٹرک کرفیو کے دوران مینگورہ کے مضافات میں گھس کر مورچے بنا دیے۔
Turk_Translation_1: Tonight during the curfew, eight trucks entered the outskirts of Mingora during the curfew and made trenches.
Turk_Translation_2: Last night during curfew hours, they penetrated the suburbs of Mangora and made hideouts.
Turk_Translation_3: Tonight, during the curfew they came in 8 trucks and dug up trenches in the suburbs of Mingora.
Turk_Translation_4: Tonight, eight trucks barged into Mengura during curfew hours and created a front overnight.

Urdu: سوال یہ پیدا ہوتا ہے کہ وہ کرفیو کے باوجود وہاں کیسے پہنچے۔
Turk_Translation_1: The question that arises is how they managed to get there in spite of the curfew.
Turk_Translation_2: The question arises as to how they reached there during curfew hours.
Turk_Translation_3: The question is how they reached there in spite of the curfew.
Turk_Translation_4: The question is, how did they reach there during curfew?

Urdu: فوج اکبر بگٹی کو تو گھر میں قتل کرتکتی ہے اور طالبان کو شلامی کرتی ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: The army can kill Akbar Bugti in his house, but it salutes the Taliban.
Turk_Translation_2: The army can kill Akbar Bugti in his house and salutes Talibans.
Turk_Translation_3: The army can kill Akbar Bugti in his home but salutes the Taliban.
Turk_Translation_4: The Army can kill Akbar Bagti in his house, and salutes the Taliban.

Urdu: اللہ کے لیے کوئی اس فوج کو سمجھائے کہ سوات کی بے بس عوام کو طالبان کی گرفت سے نکالے اور یہ ثابت کرے کہ پاکستانی فوج کسی بھی دشمن پر حاوی ہو سکتی ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: For Allah's sake, somebody make this army understand that they should get the helpless people of Swat out of the Taliban's grip and prove that the Pakistani army can overpower any enemy.
Turk_Translation_2: For God's sake, someone make this army understand to help free the defenseless people of Sawat out of the grips of the Taliban and prove that the Pakistan army can overpower any kind of enemy.
Turk_Translation_3: For God's sake, someone may explain to this army to liberate the powerless people of Swat from the clutches of Taliban and prove that the Pakistan army can overpower any enemy.
Turk_Translation_4: For Allah's sake, somebody make this army understand to remove the innocent people of Swat and prove that the Pakistan Army can beat any enemy.

Urdu: حضرت فرماتے ہيں دنيا ميں زيادہ تر خون مذاہب کی بنياد پر بہايا گيا ہے، آپ مجھے بتا ديں کہ اگر مذہب نہ ہوتا تو کيا يہ خون خرابہ نہ ہوتا؟
Turk_Translation_1: The gentleman says, "Most of the blood in the world has been spilled on the basis of religions; tell me now, would there be all this killing if there were no religion?"
Turk_Translation_2: The respectable gentleman says that in the world, most of the bloodshed was caused by religion. You tell me if there had been no religion at all, had this bloodshed not happened.
Turk_Translation_3: His Highness says that most of the blood in the world has been shed in the name of religion. Tell me that if there had been no religion, would no bloodshed had taken place?
Turk_Translation_4: Hadrat said that religion has been the reason for all the bloodshed in the world. Tell me: if there were no religion, wouldn't there have been this bloodshed?

Urdu: پنجابی، پٹھان، گورا اور کالا، محسود اور دوسرے قبائل کيا يہ سب کچھ مذہب کی پيداوار ہيں؟
Turk_Translation_1: Punjabi, Pathan, white and black, Mehsood and other tribes - are they all the results of religion?
Turk_Translation_2: Are Punjabi, Pathan, white, black, Mehsud and other tribes the products of religion?
Turk_Translation_3: Are Punjabi, Pathan, white and black, Mehsud and the other tribes products of religion?
Turk_Translation_4: Punjabi, Pathan, White and Black, Mahsood and other tribes, is this an outcome of religion?

Urdu: نہيں ہرگز نہيں، جناب، مذہب ہی يہ تعليم ديتا ہے کہ کوئی گورا کوئی کالا نہيں کوئی پنجابی کوئی مہاجر نہيں ورنہ اگر مذہب نہ ہوتا توگورے کالےکی لڑائی ميں آدھی دنيا اور ذات برادری کی عداوت باقی انسان غرق ہوجاتے۔
Turk_Translation_1: No, absolutely not. Sir, religion is what teaches us that there is no black or white, no Punjabi or Muhajir. If there were no religion, half the world would have been destroyed in the battle between blacks and whites and the rest in the animosity between races.
Turk_Translation_2: No, not at all. Sir, only religion teaches us that there is no white, no black, no Punjabi, and no refugee. If there had been no religion, then half of the world would have been destroyed in the war between white and black, and the rest would have fallen prey to enmity on the basis of cost and race.
Turk_Translation_3: No, absolutely not. Sir, religion preaches that there is no distinction either between a white and a black or a Punjabi and Muhajir. Had there been no religion, half the world would have been killed in the wars of color and the rest would have perished due to the enmities based on caste.
Turk_Translation_4: No, not at all, sir. Religion teaches no difference between a white and a black, a Punjabi and a Muhajir. If it was not for religion, this world would long ago have been destroyed in the name of white and black and countless other caste-based conflicts.

Urdu: دراصل مذہب ہی انسان کو اخلاقی تربيت ديتا ہے اور اسے پابند کرتا ہے وہ يہاں اپنی مرضی سے نہيں آيا بلکہ خالق کائنات نے اس کو يہاں بھيجا ہے اور اسے يہاں اسی کے حکم کے مطابق زندگی بسر کرنی ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: Actually, it is religion that gives humans moral training and restraints. Humans did not come here on their own - the creator of the universe sent them here, and they must live according to His command.
Turk_Translation_2: In fact, religion provides moral training to human beings and makes them disciplined on the grounds that they have not been born with their own free will, but the Creator of the universe has sent them here and they have to live in this world in accordance with God's commands.
Turk_Translation_3: In fact it is the religion that provides moral training to the man and binds him that he has not come here on his own, rather he has been sent by the Creator of the universe and he has to spend his life according to His commandments.
Turk_Translation_4: Actually, it is only religion that teaches us moral values and asks us to follow it. It has not come on its own- the Creator of the Universe sent it (to us), and we have to live according to His orders.

Urdu: بحيثيت ايک مسلمان مجھے اس بات کا پورا يقين ہے اسلام ايک مکمل ضابتہ حيات ہے اور سچا مذہب ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: As a Muslim, I am sure that Islam is a complete way of life and the true religion.
Turk_Translation_2: As a Muslim, I have a firm belief that Islam is a complete code of life and a true religion.
Turk_Translation_3: As a Muslim, I am absolutely certain that Islam is a complete code of life and a true religion.
Turk_Translation_4: As a Muslim, I completely believe that Islam is a complete way of life and a true religion.

Urdu: لندن ميں رہائش اختيار کرنے کے بعد کی سال تک ميں ہر صبح پہلے ٹيلفون پر اپنے ہر رشتہ دار کی خيرت معلوم کرتی حالانکہ بيشتر نے کبھی ايک بار بھی فون کرکے ہماری خبر نہيں لی پھر مجھے احساس ہوگيا کہ انہيں ہمارا فون کرنا بھی گوارا نہيں ہوتا ہم نے فون کرنا چھوڑ ديا۔
Turk_Translation_1: After moving to London, for several years I called each of my relatives first thing in the morning to ask how they were doing, although most of them had never even called me once to ask how I was doing. Then I realized that they do not even like me calling them. I stopped calling them.
Turk_Translation_2: After having settled in London, for several years I used to call each relative daily in the morning to get to know their health, but despite this, the majority of them did not even call on a single occasion to inquire about us; then I realized that they weren't even welcoming our telephone call and I stopped calling them.
Turk_Translation_3: After taking up residence in London, I used to call each of my relatives every morning to ask about their well being even though they did not return the favor even once. Then I realized that they even did not like our calling them and we stopped making the calls.
Turk_Translation_4: After settling down in London, every morning I would call my relatives to ask about their well-being, whereas the fact is that not one of them had ever bothered to call me and ask how we are doing. Then I realized that they don't even like us to call them. I stopped calling them.

Urdu: يھاں دو سال سے فرانس ميں رھتے ھوۓ ميں نے بھی يھی محسوس کيا ھے۔
Turk_Translation_1: I have felt the same living here in France for two years.
Turk_Translation_2: While living in France during the last two years, I got the same feeling.
Turk_Translation_3: During my two years' stay here in France, I have also felt the same.
Turk_Translation_4: Living here in France for two years, I also felt the same.

Urdu: پتھ نھيں کيوں لوگ صرف ھم سے فون کی اُميد رکھتے ھيں۔
Turk_Translation_1: I don't know why but people expect me to be the one to make the phone call.
Turk_Translation_2: I don't know why people expect only from us to call them.
Turk_Translation_3: I wonder why do people - expect us to make phone calls.
Turk_Translation_4: I don't understand why people expect only us to call.

Urdu: عراق کے بارے میں قراداد چند گھنٹوں میں پاس، دارفر کےلیے ’امن‘ فوج بھیجنا کوئی مسئلہ ہی نہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: A resolution about Iraq passed in a few hours; sending "peace" troops to Darfur is not a problem at all.
Turk_Translation_2: The resolution against Iraq was passed in just a few hours and dispatching a 'peace' force to Darfur is not a problem at all.
Turk_Translation_3: The resolution about Iraq passed in a few hours, sending 'peace' force to Darfur no problem at all.
Turk_Translation_4: A bill about Iraq is passed in a few hours. Sending a 'peace' army to Darfur is not an issue.

Urdu: ممبئی حملوں کی فورا مذمت اور مشتبہ تنظیموں پہ پابندی تو چند گھنٹوں کا کام ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: Immediate condemnation of the Mumbai attacks and a sanction on suspected organizations is in a matter of a few hours.
Turk_Translation_2: Immediately condemning the Mumbai attacks and banning suspected organizations is an exercise of a few hours.
Turk_Translation_3: =Prompt condemnation of the Mumbai attacks and ban on the suspected organizations takes only a few hours.
Turk_Translation_4: The Mumbai attack was immediately condemned, and banning suspicious organizations is just a matter of few hours.

Urdu: اور جہاں موت رقص کرتی پھر رہی ہے اس بارے ہم صلاح مشورہ کر رہے ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: And we are deliberating about the places where death is rampant.
Turk_Translation_2: And about the place where death is dancing we are in the process of consultations.
Turk_Translation_3: And where the dance of death is on, we are procrastinating.
Turk_Translation_4: And we are debating about a place where death is dancing on our heads?

Urdu: ارے او عالمی امن کے ٹھیکیدارو یہاں تو زندگی ختم ہو رہی ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: Hey you architects of world peace, lives are ending here!
Turk_Translation_2: O' the custodians of world peace, the life is disappearing here.
Turk_Translation_3: O contractors of world peace, life is dying here.
Turk_Translation_4: O the custodians of world peace! Here, life is ending.

Urdu: کیا واقعی اس کے ختم ہونے کا انتظار تو نہیں ہو رہا۔
Turk_Translation_1: Are you perhaps just waiting for it to end?
Turk_Translation_2: Does the end of this is not being awaited in reality?
Turk_Translation_3: -are they waiting for its real extermination?
Turk_Translation_4: Are you waiting for it to take its last breath?

Urdu: تاکہ پھر کوئی مظلوم اپنا حق حاصل کرنے کے لیے غلیل جیسا وسیع تر تباہی پھیلانے والا ہتھیار استعمال کرنے کے بارے میں سوچ بھی نہ سکے؟
Turk_Translation_1: So that no oppressed person can even think of using a weapon of mass destruction like a slingshot to get his rights?
Turk_Translation_2: So that any depressed cannot even think of using an extensively destructive weapon like the slingshot to get his right.
Turk_Translation_3: So that then no sufferer can even think of using a weapon of mass destruction like a slingshot to win his rights?
Turk_Translation_4: So that no victim on this earth will think again of using a weapon of mass destruction like the catapult?

Urdu: جب ایک باپ اپنے جگر گوشے کا لاشہ اٹھائے بھاگ رہا ہوتا ہے تو پھر بھی تمھارے دل کے کسی حصے میں درد کی کوئی لہر نھیں اٹھتی؟
Turk_Translation_1: When a father is fleeing with the corpse of his dear son in his hands, does no part of your heart ache, even then?
Turk_Translation_2: When a father is seen running with the dead body of his beloved child, then, too, don't you feel the waves of pain in any part of your heart?
Turk_Translation_3: When a father is running, carrying the dead body of his beloved child, do you still not feel a pain in any part of your heart?
Turk_Translation_4: when a father runs carrying his son's dead body on his shoulder, does it move you, or does your heart remain without a shiver of pain?

Urdu: اگر نہیں تو تم انسان کہلانے کے حقدار ہی نہیں ہوتم۔
Turk_Translation_1: If not, then you don't deserve to be called human.
Turk_Translation_2: If not, then you are not worthy of being regarded as a human being.
Turk_Translation_3: If not, then you do not have the right to be called a human being.
Turk_Translation_4: If not, then you don't deserve to be called a human being,

Urdu: بلکہ انسانیت کے نام پر سیاہ دھبہ ہو۔
Turk_Translation_1: You're a black stain on the name of humanity.
Turk_Translation_2: But in fact you are a symbol of shame for humanity.
Turk_Translation_3: Rather, you are a stigma on the face of humanity.
Turk_Translation_4: but rather a blot on the name of humanity.

Urdu: چليں يہ تو ثابت ہوا کہ يہ علاقہ ہزاروں سال سے اسرائيليوں کا بھی وطن ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: So it is proven that this area was the homeland of the Israelis, too, for thousands of years.
Turk_Translation_2: It has been proven that for thousands of years this region has also been the country of the Israelis.
Turk_Translation_3: Well, at least this much is proved that this land has also been the home of the Israelites for thousands of years.
Turk_Translation_4: Well, at least this has established the fact that this has been Israel's country for thousands of years.

Urdu: ہونا تو يہ چاہيۓ کہ يہ دونوں اقوام مل جل کر آپس ميں پيار و محبت سے رہيں، ليکن ان کی ڈورياں چونکہ مغرب اور عرب ممالک کے ہاتھ ميں ہيں، اس ليۓ ان کی مرضی کے بغير يہاں کبھی امن قائم نہيں ہوسکتا۔
Turk_Translation_1: Ideally, both nations should live together in peace, but since their strings are in the hands of the West and the Arab countries, there can never be peace here without their approval.
Turk_Translation_2: What these two nations should do is live together with love and fondness, but since the strings of their control are in the hands of Western and Arabic countries, that is why peace can never be established here without their will.
Turk_Translation_3: The proper course would be that these two nations live together amiably. But, since their strings are in the hands of the West and the Arabs, there can be no peace here without their consent.
Turk_Translation_4: The need of the moment requires both communities to live together with love and harmony, but since their chords are in the hands of Western and Arab countries, peace cannot be restored until and unless they wish it to be.

Urdu: بلکہ اب تو ايران بھی اپنی پراکسی وار يہاں سے لڑنا چاہتا ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: Even Iran now wants to fight its proxy war from here.
Turk_Translation_2: In fact, now Iran also wants to fight its proxy war from this region.
Turk_Translation_3: Now even Iran wants to fight its proxy war from here.
Turk_Translation_4: Now even Iran wants to fight her proxy war from this land.

Urdu: اسرائيلی کارروائی وقتی طور پر رک بھی گئی تو پھر کسی واقعہ کے بعد شروع ہو جائے گي۔
Turk_Translation_1: Even if the Israeli operation stops for the time being, it will start up again after some other incident.
Turk_Translation_2: If Israeli attacks cease for the time being then it will recommence following some other another incident.
Turk_Translation_3: If somehow the Israeli action might stop for the time being, it would start again in the wake of some incident.
Turk_Translation_4: Even if Israel stops its assault for now, it would merely require a single incident to restart it all over again.

Urdu: بی بی سی کے ملک کے مفادات امريکہ و اسرائيل نوازی سے وابستہ ہيں اور يہی وجہ ہے کہ ’روشن خيالي‘ کی آڑ ميں يہ ’صيہونيت پسندي‘ پر مشتمل بلاگز کی ايک سيريز لے کر وارد ہوا ہے اور يکطرفہ اور اندھا ’پراپيگنڈہ‘ کر رہا ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: The interests of BBC's country lie with favoring America and Israel, and this is the reason why it has come out with a series of blogs on "Zionism" in the guise of "open-mindedness" and is making blind and one-sided "propaganda."
Turk_Translation_2: The BBC's country's interests are linked with its services to America and Israel and this is the reason that in the grab of 'enlightenment' they have emerged with a series of blogs to project 'Judaism,' and carrying out one-sided and 'blind' propaganda.
Turk_Translation_3: The interests of the BBC's country are associated with American and Israeli agendas and this is the reason that it has arrived with a series of blogs consisting of 'pro-jewish' material in the guise of 'enlightenment' and is engaged in one-sided and blind 'propaganda'.
Turk_Translation_4: The BBC's country shares its benefits with America and Israel, and this is the reason why they came up with a series of 'Sahyooniyat Pasand' blogs under the guise of 'open mindedness,' and is offering one-sided propaganda.

Urdu: بی بی سی محض ’فارميلٹي‘ پوری کر رہا ہے اور محض ہمدردياں سميٹنا ہی اس کا مقصد و منشاء ہے!
Turk_Translation_1: BBC is merely fulfilling a formality and its only aim is to gather sympathies.
Turk_Translation_2: The BBC is merely completing 'formalities,' whereas its real intention and objective is only to gather sympathies!
Turk_Translation_3: BBC is merely fulfilling the 'formality' and its sole purpose is to win sympathies!
Turk_Translation_4: The BBC is only observing 'formalities,' and its only objective and motto are to gather sympathy.

Urdu: موڈريٹر صاحب سے گذارش ہے کہ فدوی کے اس تبصرہ کو شائع کيا جائے تاکہ کچھ اندازہ ہوجائے کہ بی بی سی ميں حقائق پسندي کا تھوڑا بہت مادہ ابھی تک باقی ہے۔
