Turk_Translation_1: The moderator is requested to publish the comment of this humble applicant so that we can get an idea whether BBC still has any semblance of realism its material.
Turk_Translation_2: I request the moderator to publish my comments so that we can get some idea about the remaining magnitude of the BBC's fact-loving aspect.
Turk_Translation_3: Mr. Moderator is requested to kindly publish my comments so that one may have feelings that there still is some element of pro-realistic attitude left in BBC.
Turk_Translation_4: It's a request to the moderator to publish Fidwi's review again so that we understand that there are some traces of truth remaining in the BBC.

Urdu: شکريہ۔
Turk_Translation_1: Thanks.
Turk_Translation_2: Thanks.
Turk_Translation_3: Thanks.
Turk_Translation_4: Thanks.

Urdu: پتہ نہيں يہ کہانی کس نے لکھی کيسے وجود ميں آئی ليکن ايک بات ضرور ہے ہر زمانے ميں ڈريکولا معصوم انسانوں کا خون پيتے رہے ہيں،
Turk_Translation_1: Whoever wrote this story or however it came into existence, it is true that every age has had a Dracula who drinks innocent human blood.
Turk_Translation_2: Don't know who wrote this story or how it came into being, but one thing is clear - that in every age, Draculas have been sucking the blood of innocent human beings,
Turk_Translation_3: No one knows who wrote this story and how did it come into being but one thing stands tested that in every age, the Dracula have been feeding on the blood of the innocent people,
Turk_Translation_4: I don't know who wrote this story or how this story came into being, but one thing is clear- that in every era Dracula has been drinking human blood.

Urdu: ہر زمانے ميں جنگيں ہوتی رہی ہيں اور ہر زمانے ميں خون بہتا رہا ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: Every age has seen wars and every age has seen bloodshed.
Turk_Translation_2: wars have been taking place in every age, and blood has been flowing during all these times.
Turk_Translation_3: there have been wars and bloodshed in every age.
Turk_Translation_4: Battles were fought in every age and there was bloodshed.

Urdu: ليکن حيرت کی بات يہ ہے کہ اکيسويں صدی کا يہ انسان جو اپنے آپ کو بہت مہذب مانتا ہے کيسے دن دہاڑے اور سر عام ہونے والے اس قتل عام پر خاموش ہے،
Turk_Translation_1: The strange thing is how this person who thinks himself a very cultured person of the twenty-first century is silent over this massacre in broad daylight;
Turk_Translation_2: But it is a matter of surprise as to why the human being of the 21st century, who regards himself as very civilized, is silent upon the open massacres being committed in broad daylight,
Turk_Translation_3: But the surprising thing is that how can this man of the twenty first century who considers himself to be thoroughly civilized remain quiet over this open and blatant massacre,
Turk_Translation_4: But surprisingly, the 21st century man, who claims to be more civilized, is keeping mum about these killings.

Urdu: کيسے يہ اس بات کو محسوس نہيں کرتا کہ جو کچھ ہورہا ہے وہ انسانيت کی ايک بد ترين شکل پيش کررہا ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: how he cannot feel that what is happening is showing the worst possible face of humanity.
Turk_Translation_2: why are they not feeling this that whatever is happening today is presenting the worst form of humanity.
Turk_Translation_3: how come he does not feel that whatever is taking place, is presenting the worst facade of humanity.
Turk_Translation_4: Whatever is happening is presenting a bad face of humanity (before us). How can you fail to feel it?

Urdu: افسوس ناک اور المناک پہلو تو يہ ہے کہ تہذيب يافتہ انسان کا يہ سياہ پہلو آنے والی صدی کے ايک اور انسان کے سامنے کيا تصوير پيش کرے گا۔
Turk_Translation_1: The sad and tragic part of it is what picture this dark side of the cultured person will present to the person of the coming century.
Turk_Translation_2: The sad and tragic aspect is that what picture this shameful aspect of the civilized man will present to the man of the coming century.
Turk_Translation_3: The regrettable and sad aspect is that what picture will the dark face of this civilized man present before the man of the following centuries.
Turk_Translation_4: The dilemma and the disappointing phase of this civilized human race is, how this dark shade of his character is seen after a generation, how he will be portrayed.

Urdu: خير انديش، سجادالحسنين، حيدرآباد دکن
Turk_Translation_1: Best regards, Sajjad ul-Hasnain, Hyderabad Deccan
Turk_Translation_2: Well-wisher, Sijjadul Husnain, Hyderabad Daccan.
Turk_Translation_3: Well wisher, Sajjad-ul-Husnain, Hyderabad Deccan
Turk_Translation_4: Sincerely, Sajjah al Hasnain, Hydrabad, Deccan.

Urdu: اس وقت ڈیرہ غازی خان کے ساتھ ساتھ پورے ملک میں موسم سرما کی بارشیں ہو رہی ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: Right now, along with Dera Ghazi Khan, the whole country is receiving winter rains.
Turk_Translation_2: These days the whole country, including Dera Ghazi Khan, is having winter rains.
Turk_Translation_3: The winter rains are on these days in Dera Ghazi Khan and in the rest of the country.
Turk_Translation_4: Right now summer rains have started showering on Dera Gazi Khan along with the whole country.

Urdu: موسم کے مطابق ایک نظم حاضر ہے، اس نظم کے ساتھ ساتھ بارش انجوائے کیجیئے۔
Turk_Translation_1: Here's a poem that goes along with the weather. Along with this poem, enjoy the rain.
Turk_Translation_2: In line with the weather a poem is being presented; enjoy the rain with this poem.
Turk_Translation_3: Here is a poem in keeping with the weather conditions. Enjoy this poem with the rain.
Turk_Translation_4: I am presenting a poem depicting the climate. Enjoy the rain with this poem.

Urdu: یہ بارشیں بھی تم سے ہیں
Turk_Translation_1: Even these rains are like you
Turk_Translation_2: These rains too are because of you
Turk_Translation_3: These rains come with you
Turk_Translation_4: It rains because of you.

Urdu: جو برس گئی تو بہار ہیں
Turk_Translation_1: When they fall, there is spring
Turk_Translation_2: If they rain, they become enjoyment
Turk_Translation_3: When they pour down, they are the heralds of spring
Turk_Translation_4: If raining, it is winter.

Urdu: جو ٹھہر گئی تو قرار ہیں
Turk_Translation_1: When they pause, there is rest
Turk_Translation_2: If they don't rain, they become contentment
Turk_Translation_3: When they stop, they are the inner peace
Turk_Translation_4: If it stops, it is patience.

Urdu: کبھی آ گئی یونہی بے سبب
Turk_Translation_1: At times, coming without a reason
Turk_Translation_2: Sometimes they arrive without any plan
Turk_Translation_3: Sometimes they come for no apparent reason
Turk_Translation_4: Sometimes it comes without reason.

Urdu: کبھی چھا گئی یوں ہی روزِ شب
Turk_Translation_1: At times, engulfing day with night
Turk_Translation_2: Sometimes they come day and night
Turk_Translation_3: Sometimes they are here day and night
Turk_Translation_4: Sometimes it blankets like a night.

Urdu: کبھی شور ہیں کبھی چپ سی ہیں
Turk_Translation_1: At times there is noise, at times silence
Turk_Translation_2: Sometimes they make noise and sometimes keep calm
Turk_Translation_3: Noisy they are, and quiet sometimes
Turk_Translation_4: Sometimes it is sound, and sometimes it is silent.

Urdu: یہ بارشیں بھی تم سے ہیں
Turk_Translation_1: Even these rains are like you
Turk_Translation_2: These rains too are because of you
Turk_Translation_3: These rains come with you
Turk_Translation_4: It rains because of you.

Urdu: کسی یاد میں کسی رات کو
Turk_Translation_1: In someone's thoughts some night
Turk_Translation_2: In the memory of someone on some night
Turk_Translation_3: In some memory on a night
Turk_Translation_4: in my memory some night

Urdu: اک دبی ہوئی سی راکھ کو
Turk_Translation_1: Buried ash
Turk_Translation_2: An ash that was hidden
Turk_Translation_3: And in these subdued embers
Turk_Translation_4: to a bowed ash

Urdu: کبھی یوں ہوا کہ بجھا دیا
Turk_Translation_1: Once extinguished
Turk_Translation_2: Sometimes so happened that it was put out
Turk_Translation_3: Put out sometimes
Turk_Translation_4: I had defused it forever, sometimes.

Urdu: کبھی خود سے خود کو جلا دیا
Turk_Translation_1: Which again ignited itself
Turk_Translation_2: And sometimes burned itself with its own fire
Turk_Translation_3: And sometimes burnt myself
Turk_Translation_4: And sometimes I lit myself with me.

Urdu: کبھی بوند بوند میں غم سی ہیں
Turk_Translation_1: At times there is grief in every drop
Turk_Translation_2: Sometimes their sadness shows from every drop
Turk_Translation_3: Sometimes there is sadness in every drop
Turk_Translation_4: There are drops of agony at times.

Urdu: یہ بارشیں بھی تم سے ہیں
Turk_Translation_1: Even these rains are like you
Turk_Translation_2: These rains too are because of you
Turk_Translation_3: These rains come with you
Turk_Translation_4: It rains because of you.

Urdu: یہ سارے حکمران ایک بریف کیس اٹھا کر بھاگنے والے ہیں، انکو کیا، ملک رہے یا نا رہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: All these rulers are about to run away with briefcase in hand. They couldn't care less whether the country survives or not.
Turk_Translation_2: All our leaders are the category of people who run away with their briefcases; they have no concern if the country exists or not.
Turk_Translation_3: These rulers are about to run away with a briefcase; whether the country survives or not, they don't care.
Turk_Translation_4: All these leaders will run with their briefcases- they don't care if the country survives or not.

Urdu: عوام منجن بیچے یا لیموں کا چھلکا لے کر مندروں کی گھنٹیاں مانجھ رہی ہو۔
Turk_Translation_1: Whether the people sell toothpaste or clean the bells of a temple with the skin of a lemon.
Turk_Translation_2: They have no concern whether the public sells toothpowder, or cleans the bells of temples with lemon peels.
Turk_Translation_3: Whether the public sells tooth powder or polishes the bells in the temples with the rind of the lemon.
Turk_Translation_4: Whether people sell tooth powder or clean temple bells with lemon peels.

Urdu: ایک تو ہمارا میڈیا بھی حکمرانوں کی طرح حرام خور ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: For one thing, our media is as corrupt as our rulers.
Turk_Translation_2: Like our rulers, our media is also corrupt.
Turk_Translation_3: Our media, too, is corrupt like our rulers.
Turk_Translation_4: On the one hand our media also is also corrupt like our leaders

Urdu: اسکا مقصد صرف اور صرف حکومت سے پیسے بٹورنا ہے اور کچھ نہیں۔

Turk_Translation_3: On the one hand, credit card makes life easy for you and on the other hand, it tightens the grip of the law enforcing agencies on your private life
Turk_Translation_4: While using a credit card makes your life easier, it also allows law-enforcement organizations to monitor your personal life.

Urdu: کہ اب صرف مالی معاملات جیسے کریڈٹ کارڈ کے استعمال کے ریکارڈ سے آپ کا پتہ لگایا جا سکتا ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: Now you can be traced through financial transactions such as the record of your use of a credit card.
Turk_Translation_2: that now your whereabouts can be traced just through financial dealings, for example the use of credit card.
Turk_Translation_3: because you can now be revealed through financial transactions like the records of your credit card.
Turk_Translation_4: Now, with the help of your credit card financial transaction record, you can be traced.

Urdu: اور مستقبل میں جب اصل زر استعمال کرنا انتہائی کم ہو جائے گا اس کی افادیت اور بڑھ جائے گی۔
Turk_Translation_1: And in the future, when the use of real money becomes extremely rare, it will be even more useful.
Turk_Translation_2: In the future, when the use of real currency will get minimized to a greater extent, its usefulness will increase.
Turk_Translation_3: And in future when the use of actual currency will be considerably reduced, its usefulness will expand.
Turk_Translation_4: And in future, when the use of actual money will be less, its importance will increase.

Urdu: اسی طرح جرائم کی دنیا میں بھی بنک لوٹنے کا خطرہ مول لینے کی بجائے کریڈٹ کارڈ کی معلومات اڑا لی جاتی ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: In the crime world too, instead of taking the risk of robbing a bank, the information from a credit card is hacked.
Turk_Translation_2: In the same way, in the criminal world too, instead of taking the risk of bank burglary, the credit card information is stolen.
Turk_Translation_3: Similarly in the crime world, the credit card details are hacked rather than going through the hazards of robbing the bank.
Turk_Translation_4: Similarly, in the crime world, credit card information is preferred to robbing a bank.

Urdu: اسی طرح اب دوستی کرنے کے بھی کمپیوٹری ذرائع بن چکے ہیں
Turk_Translation_1: Similarly, now there are even ways of making friends through computers.
Turk_Translation_2: In the same way, building friendship is also being done through computer resources.
Turk_Translation_3: Similarly, computerized means are now available to develop friendships.
Turk_Translation_4: In the same way, the computer has become a medium to make friends,

Urdu: ، سوشل نیٹ ورکنگ ویب سائٹس جیسے آرکٹ ، فیس بک اور مائی سپیس مقبولیت میں پہلے درجہ میں آتی ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: Social networking websites like Orkut, Facebook, and Myspace rank highest in terms of popularity.
Turk_Translation_2: Social networking Web sites, e.g. Orkut, Facebook and Myspace, are rated first in terms of popularity.
Turk_Translation_3: Social networking websites such as Orkut, Facebook, and Myspace are top ranked websites in terms of popularity.
Turk_Translation_4: Social networking websites like Orkut, Facebook and My Space are on top in the popularity chart.

Urdu: لیکن کیا آپ کو نہیں لگتا کہ ذہنی طور پر ہم جتنا ان سوشل نیٹ ورکس کے مطیع ہوتے جا رہے ہیں، عملی طور پر لوگوں سے اتنا ہی دور ہوتے جا رہے ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: But don't you think that the more we comply with these social networking sites, the more we are getting distanced from people on a practical level?
Turk_Translation_2: But don't you feel that, as we get more and more under the influence of these social networks mentally, in the same way, we are practically getting more and more isolated from people.
Turk_Translation_3: But don't you think that the more we rely on these social networks, the more we are distanced from the people practically.
Turk_Translation_4: Don't you think the more we are becoming a slave of this social networking, the more we are getting away from people of practical life?

Urdu: اسی طرح میچ میکنگ کی ویب سائٹ ہیں، جہاں پر آپ کی پسند کو دیگر لوگوں کی پسند سے ملا کر مطابقت رکھنے والے لوگوں کی فہرست آپ کو دکھا دی جاتی ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: There are even match-making websites, where your preferences are matched with the preferences of other people and the list of those compatible with you is provided.
Turk_Translation_2: In a similar manner, there are matchmaking Web sites in which your likes are matched with other peoples' likes and a list of compatible people is shown to you.
Turk_Translation_3: Similarly, there are match making websites where you are shown the list of people by matching the list of your choices with their choices.
Turk_Translation_4: There are match-making web sites where your likings are matched with other people, and matched lists are shown to the people interested.

Urdu: اب کیا آپ بالکل اپنے جیسے ہی ایک اور شخص سے زندگی گزار سکتے ہیں؟
Turk_Translation_1: Now can you spend your life with another person who is just like you?
Turk_Translation_2: Can you live your life with another person exactly similar to you?
Turk_Translation_3: Can you spend your life with someone who is exactly like you?
Turk_Translation_4: Can you live a life of some person who is exactly like you?

Urdu: میں تو نہیں گزار سکتا اسی لئے تو جیون ساتھی کو نصف بہتر بھی کہتے ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: I cannot. The reason why a life partner is also called the better half
Turk_Translation_2: I cannot live, that is why a life partner is also called a better half.
Turk_Translation_3: I cannot. The life partner is, therefore, also called the better half.
Turk_Translation_4: I can't live such a life. This is why a life partner is called the better half

Urdu: کہ جو خامیاں مجھ میں ہوں انہیں وہ پورا کرے۔
Turk_Translation_1: is that they make up for my flaws.
Turk_Translation_2: This means that the flaws that exist in my personality, my spouse covers them.
Turk_Translation_3: So that he/she may compensate for my shortcomings.
Turk_Translation_4: so that she fills me with what is not in me.

Urdu: مجھے شائد عقل میں کچھ حصہ کم ہی ملا۔
Turk_Translation_1: I may have gotten the lesser share of wisdom.
Turk_Translation_2: Perhaps I got a lesser portion of acumen.
Turk_Translation_3: I wasn't probably blessed with my due share of wisdom.
Turk_Translation_4: I think I have very little brains.

Urdu: بچپن سے کوئ بڑا جو بھی بات کہتا میرے لیے سچ ہی ہوتی۔
Turk_Translation_1: Since childhood, whatever my elders said was the truth to me.
Turk_Translation_2: In my childhood, I used to accept as being true whatever a person of old age had said.
Turk_Translation_3: Right from my childhood, everything that any elder said was the truth for me.
Turk_Translation_4: Right from my childhood, whatever my elders told me about something, it became the ultimate truth for me,

Urdu: اسی طرح جیسے مجہے یقین تھا اباجان کو دنیا کے ہر سوال کا جواب معلوم ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: For example, I was sure that my father knew the answers to all the questions in the world.
Turk_Translation_2: In the same way, I had full confidence that Dad knew the answer to every question in the world.
Turk_Translation_3: Just as I believed that my father knew the answer to every question of the world.
Turk_Translation_4: as if my Abba Jaan knows the answers to all the questions.

Urdu: میرا اس پر بہت مذاق بھی اڑتا۔
Turk_Translation_1: I was even made fun of because of this.
Turk_Translation_2: Because of this, I was ridiculed.
Turk_Translation_3: I used to be ridiculed for this behavior.
Turk_Translation_4: People used to mock me.

Urdu: مگر صرف وہ بات سچ لگتی جو ممکن بھی ھوسکتی تھی۔
Turk_Translation_1: However, something seemed true to me only if it could be possible.
Turk_Translation_2: But only those things that were possible appeared true to me.
Turk_Translation_3: But only the possible things seemed to be true.
Turk_Translation_4: But I always believed in something which could be possible.

Urdu: بہت الجھن ہوتی کہ جھوٹ بولنے کی کیا ضرورت تھی۔
Turk_Translation_1: It was very perplexing why there was a need to lie.
Turk_Translation_2: I used to feel great hesitation upon the need of telling lies.
Turk_Translation_3: I felt uneasy about telling a lie.
Turk_Translation_4: I get restless thinking that there was no need to say false things.

Urdu: اس عمر میں بھی اس بات سے نقصان اٹھایا۔
Turk_Translation_1: I even suffered at that age for this reason.
Turk_Translation_2: In that age, too, I was at a loss due to this.
Turk_Translation_3: And I have suffered even at present age because of this habit.
Turk_Translation_4: Even in this age I faced loss.

Urdu: لہٰذا میری کوشش ہوتی ہے جھوٹ کم سے کم بولوں۔
Turk_Translation_1: Therefore, I try to lie as little as possible.
Turk_Translation_2: As such, I try to tell minimum lies.
Turk_Translation_3: I, therefore, try to resort to lying as little as possible -.
Turk_Translation_4: Therefore I make the effort to speak less and less false.

Urdu: کسی کو جھوٹا لارا مت لگاؤں اور وہ بھی اللہ کا نام ساتھ لگا کر۔
Turk_Translation_1: I try not to give anyone false hopes, especially in the name of Allah.
Turk_Translation_2: Don't enter into a false promise with anyone by citing the name of Allah.
Turk_Translation_3: I don't want to give someone a false hope, especially in the name of God.
Turk_Translation_4: Don't blame anyone for the wrong reasons, and that too swearing in the name of Allah

Urdu: اور انشاءاللہ تبھی کہوں جب اللہ سے دعا ہو کہ کام پورا کر دے۔
Turk_Translation_1: And I only say "Allah willing" when praying to Allah that he fulfill some request.
Turk_Translation_2: And I mention Insha' Allah only when I am praying for something to get done.
Turk_Translation_3: And use God Willing only when I pray to God for a particular job.
Turk_Translation_4: and Insha Allah, whatever you will ask from Allah, will be fulfilled.

Urdu: باقی نیتوں کا حال تو اللہ ہی بہتر جانتا ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: Allah knows best what my intentions are.
Turk_Translation_2: Rest Allah knows better what is in our hearts.
Turk_Translation_3: In any case, only God knows the intentions better.
Turk_Translation_4: Rest, Allah is aware of your intentions.

Urdu: یہ ایک گھناؤنا مسئلہ ہے جو دین سے دوری کی وجہ سے پیدا ہوا ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: This is a nauseating problem, which has arisen because of estrangement from religion.
Turk_Translation_2: This is a disgusting issue that came into existence as a result of being away from religion.
Turk_Translation_3: This is a dreadful problem and has been caused by the estrangement from religion.
Turk_Translation_4: This is a disgusting problem that occurs because people are away from religion.

Urdu: ھمارا دین اور پاکستان کا قانون دونوں کے مطابق کم سن بچے ماں کے پاس رہنا چاہئیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: According to both our religion and the law of Pakistan, young children should stay with their mother.
Turk_Translation_2: In accordance with both our religion and the laws of Pakistan, innocent children should live with their mothers.
Turk_Translation_3: According to our religion and the constitution of Pakistan, the infants should stay with the mother.
Turk_Translation_4: According both to our religion and Pakistan's law, the custody of a minor child should be given to the mother.

Urdu: ان کا خرچ ان کے باپ کے ذمہ ہے اور باپ بچوں سے مل سکتا ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: It is the father's duty to take care of their expenses, and he is allowed to meet with the children.
Turk_Translation_2: Their maintenance is the responsibility of the father, who can meet with them.
Turk_Translation_3: The father is responsible for their subsistence and can meet them.
Turk_Translation_4: Their expenses are the responsibility of the father, and he can also visit the children.

Urdu: پھر جب بچے بالغ ہو جائیں تو وھ جس کے پاس رہنا چاہیں رہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: Then when the children grow up, they can live with whomever they want.
Turk_Translation_2: When children become adults, it is up to them to decide with whom they want to live.
Turk_Translation_3: When the children mature, they may choose with whom they want to live.
Turk_Translation_4: Once the children become adults, it is their choice whom they want to live with.

Urdu: آپ نے درست لکہا ہے کہ اصل مسئلہ عزیز و اقارب ہیں جو الٹی پٹیاں پڑھاتے ہیں
Turk_Translation_1: You have rightly pointed out that relatives are the real problem because they give the wrong advice.
Turk_Translation_2: You have rightly said that kith and kin are the real problems who teach inappropriate lessons.
Turk_Translation_3: You have correctly written that the real problem is the relatives who misguide
Turk_Translation_4: You wrote it right that the real problems lie with the relatives who give wrong suggestions.

Urdu: جاگیردارانہ سوچ ہمارے تمام اعمال پر حاوی ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: The feudal mindset dictates all our actions.
Turk_Translation_2: Feudal thinking is heavily influencing our all actions.
Turk_Translation_3: The feudal mindset determines all our actions.
Turk_Translation_4: Federal thinking controls our actions.

Urdu: یہاں بھی یہی سوچ کام کر رہی ہے کہ باپ کی جائیداد میں نئے حصے دار پیدا ہوں گے اور اسی کی مخالفت کی جاتی ہے ورنہ ان کے والد کا یہ عمل تو قابل ستائش و تقلید ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: The same mindset is at work here, that our father will have more children to claim their share in his property, so he must be stopped; if it weren't for this, their father's act would be praised and emulated.
Turk_Translation_2: The thought working behind it is that new successors to share the property of father will be produced and this development is opposed, otherwise the action of their father is appreciable and should be practiced.
Turk_Translation_3: Even here the same mindset is working that new shareholders in the inheritance of their father will be born and this very fact is resented. Otherwise, this act of their father is worth praising and following.
Turk_Translation_4: Here also, the same thinking seems to be functioning in that new people will be sharing in ancestral property and then they oppose it. Otherwise what their father had done is commendable and could be imitated.

Urdu: ہمارے ہاں رشتہ کے حوالے سے انہی جکڑ بندیوں نے معاشرتی برائیاں پیدا کی ہیں
Turk_Translation_1: It is these hang-ups about marriage that have created the evils in our society.
Turk_Translation_2: In our society, restrictions with reference to relationships have created social evils.
Turk_Translation_3: These restrictions regarding match-making have given rise to social evils in our society
Turk_Translation_4: As far as relationships are concerned, these restrictions created social problems.

Urdu: ، مطلقہ اور بیوہ کی شادی کا تصور ناپید ہوتا جا رہا ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: The concept of a marriage for a divorced or widowed woman is becoming extinct.
Turk_Translation_2: The concept of marriage of widows and divorced is disappearing day by day.
Turk_Translation_3: the concept of the marriage of the widow or the divorced woman is becoming extinct.
Turk_Translation_4: Getting a divorcee or a widow married is becoming tougher with passing time.

Urdu: یہی فضول عقائد و بے جا روایات ہیں جن کی وجہ سے خاندانی نظام انتشار کا شکار ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: Because of these useless beliefs and misplaced traditions, the family system is breaking down.
Turk_Translation_2: These useless values and inappropriate traditions are putting the family system in disarray.
Turk_Translation_3: Owing to these useless beliefs and unreasonable customs, the family structure is suffering from disintegration.
Turk_Translation_4: Because of these unnecessary customs and traditions, the family system is on the verge of dispersion.

Urdu: ہمارے معاشرے میں اگر ایک پچاس پچبن سالہ شخص کی بیوی یا کسی بیوی کا شوہر اگر اگے جہاں روانہ ہو جائے اور وہ دوسری شادی کر لیں، تو اسے اچھی نظر سے کیوں نہیں دیکھا جاتا؟
Turk_Translation_1: Why does our society frown upon the re-marriage of a 50- or 55-year-old husband or wife who has lost his or her spouse?
Turk_Translation_2: In our society, if the wife or husband of a 50-55 year-old dies and he/she enters into a second marriage, then why is this not viewed to be a good practice?
Turk_Translation_3: In our society, if the spouse of a fifty or fifty-five years old person dies and the widow or the widower may marry someone else, why is it looked down upon with such disapproval?
Turk_Translation_4: If the wife of a 50-55 year old man or a husband of a wife of the same age passed away in our society and they opt for a second marriage, why don't we see this positively?

Urdu: ہمارے قریب ایک پاکستانی انکل ہیں، ان کی بیوی دس بارہ سال قبل انتقال کر گئی تھیں، اب سب بچوں کی شادیاں کرنے کے بعد انہوں نے ایک بیوہ خاتون سے شادی کر لی، تو بچے ہی ان کے خلاف ہو گئے ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: We have a Pakistani uncle close to us. His wife died ten or twelve years ago. When he married a widow after getting all his children married, they all turned against him.
Turk_Translation_2: In our neighborhood, a Pakistani uncle lives whose wife died ten, twelve years ago; after getting all his children married, he then himself married a widow, as a result of which all his children turned against him.
Turk_Translation_3: A Pakistani uncle lives in our neighborhood. His wife died 10 or 12 years back. After performing the weddings of all this children, he married a widow and his children turned against him.
Turk_Translation_4: A Pakistani uncle lives nearby, his wife expired about 10-12 years ago. Now after marrying off all his children, when he married a widow, his children turn against him.

Urdu: میری نظر میں تو یہ ان کا شرعی حق ہے آپ کیا کہتے ہیں؟
Turk_Translation_1: In my view this is a right that has been granted to him by the Sharia. What do you think?
Turk_Translation_2: In my view, this is his religious right, what do you say?
Turk_Translation_3: In my opinion, this is his right by Sharia. What do you say?
Turk_Translation_4: According to me, it is his Sharia right. What do you say?

Urdu: ہمارے ہوتے کوئی ہماری ماں کی جگہ لے، یہ ہم سے برداشت نہیں ہوتا والی سوچ کس قسم کی سوچ ہے؟
Turk_Translation_1: What kind of an attitude do we have that makes us say that we can't tolerate anyone taking our mother's place?
Turk_Translation_2: We cannot bear that someone takes the place of our mother while we are alive; what type of approach is this?
Turk_Translation_3: What kind of mindset is represented by 'as long as we are alive, we cannot bear the thought of someone replacing our mother'?
Turk_Translation_4: We can't see anyone taking the place of our mother, we can't tolerate it. What kind of thinking is this?

Urdu: میرے خیال میں ان صاحب کی اولاد کو یہ سوچنا چاہئے کہ اگر سب بچوں کی شادیاں کرنے کے بعد انہوں نے ایک بیوہ خاتون سے شادی کر لی تو کیا غلط کیا؟
Turk_Translation_1: I think this man's children should consider that if he married a widow after getting all of them married, what did he do wrong?
Turk_Translation_2: In my opinion, the children of this gentleman should think that after getting all the kids married, if he enters into a marriage with a widowed woman, then what harm has he done?
Turk_Translation_3: I think the children of that man should think that he has committed no wrong by marrying a widow after the marriages of all his children?
Turk_Translation_4: According to me, the children of that person should see it logically that if he married a widow, after marrying off all his children, what is wrong in that?

Urdu: اس طرح اس بیوہ خاتون کو بھی سہارا مل گیا اور وہ انکل کو بھی کوئی گھر سنبھالنے والا مل گیا
Turk_Translation_1: This way the widow got support, and the uncle also got someone to take care of him.
Turk_Translation_2: In this way, the widowed woman got support and the uncle found a housekeeper,
Turk_Translation_3: This way, the widow found some support and the uncle too got someone to manage his household
Turk_Translation_4: This way, that widow got support and that uncle also got someone to look after his home.

Urdu: ، کیونکہ ان کے بچے یقنن اپنی اپنی دنیا مے مصروف ہو گئے ہوں گے اور ان کو وقت نھیں دیتے ہوگے.
Turk_Translation_1: Because his children must have gotten tied up in their own worlds, giving him no time.
Turk_Translation_2: because his children would certainly have become busy with their respective individual lives and were not giving time to him.
Turk_Translation_3: because his children must have got busy in their lives and would not be giving him proper time.
Turk_Translation_4: ; Because his children would definitely be engaged and happy in their own world and would not be able to devote time to him.

Urdu: اس کی وجہ جاہلیت ہے.
Turk_Translation_1: The reason behind this is ignorance.
Turk_Translation_2: Ignorance is the reason for this.
Turk_Translation_3: It is caused by ignorance
Turk_Translation_4: The reason for this is illiteracy.

Urdu: کل کو اگر ان کی بیویوں‌ نے بوڑھے کی خدمت سے انکار کر دیا تو پھر وہ کیا کریں‌گے؟
Turk_Translation_1: If their wives refuse to take care of them when they're old, what will they do?
Turk_Translation_2: Tomorrow if their wives refused serving the old man then what will they do?
Turk_Translation_3: If tomorrow their wives refused to cater to the old man, what would they do?
Turk_Translation_4: If tomorrow, their wives refuse to serve the former, what will they do?

Urdu: یہ معاشرے کے دباؤ کا نتیجہ ہے.
Turk_Translation_1: This is a result of societal pressure.
Turk_Translation_2: This is the result of pressure from society.
Turk_Translation_3: This is the result of social pressure
Turk_Translation_4: This is a result of societal pressure.

Urdu: جب لوگ ایسی حرکت پر ایسے خاندان کا مذاق اڑاتے ہیں تو اولاد باپ کی دوسری شادی پر شرمندہ ہونے لگتی ہے
Turk_Translation_1: When people ridicule a family for such a thing, children start to feel embarrassed because of their father's re-marriage,
Turk_Translation_2: When people make a joke of the family for such an act, then the children start feeling embaressad at the father's second marriage.
Turk_Translation_3: when people make fun of their family on such an act, the children begin to feel ashamed at the second marriage of the father
Turk_Translation_4: When people make fun of such families for doing something like this, then the chilren are ashamed of their parents' second marriage.

Urdu: حالانکہ انہیں حالات کا مقابلہ کرنا چاہیے اور کہنا چاہیے کہ ان کے باپ کا عمل اسلام کے عین مطابق تھا.
Turk_Translation_1: when they should face up to the situation and say that what their father did was completely in accordance with Islam.
Turk_Translation_2: Though they should fight with the circumstances saying that the action of their father was wholly in accordance with Islam.
Turk_Translation_3: though they should face the situation and tell that their father's act was absolutely in accordance with Islam
Turk_Translation_4: This situation should be fought against, and it should be mentioned that their father acted according to Islamic law.

Urdu: یہ ہمارے معاشرے میں ایک لعنت ہے جسکا ہم پچھلے 40-50 سال میں پوری طرح شکار ہو چکے ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: This is a curse in our society, which we have been suffering from for the last 40-50 years.
Turk_Translation_2: This is a curse in our society of which we have completely become a victim during the past 40-50 years.
Turk_Translation_3: This is a curse in our society and we have fallen prey to it completely over the past 40-50 years.
Turk_Translation_4: This is a curse in our society that has hunted us down in last 40-50 years.

Urdu: ایک بیوی تک کو یہ تو منظور ہے کہ میاں حرام توپیاں کرتا پھرے لیکن اسکو دوسری شادی نہیں کرنے دیتی۔
Turk_Translation_1: A wife even accepts it if her husband goes around having extra-marital relations, but she does not allow him to marry a second time.
Turk_Translation_2: It is even acceptable to a wife that her husband may continue with the immoral activities, but she does not allow him to have another marriage.
Turk_Translation_3: Even a wife accepts that her husband may fornicate but will not allow him to marry again.
Turk_Translation_4: A wife can bear an illegitimate relationship of her husband, but would not allow him a second marriage.

Urdu: اگر بس میں ہو تو اپنے مرنے کے بعد بھی نا کرنے دے۔
Turk_Translation_1: If she could, she wouldn't even let him do it after her death.
Turk_Translation_2: If this were within her control, she would not have allowed her husband to marry, even after her death.
Turk_Translation_3: And if it were in her power, she won't let him marry even after her death.
Turk_Translation_4: If it is possible they would not allow to do it even after their death.

Urdu: میاں کے ساتھ ساتھ اپنی آخرت بھی برباد کرتی ہے اور معاشرے میں گندگی پھیلنے کا ایک بڑا سبب بھی۔
Turk_Translation_1: On top of ruining things for her husband, she ruins them for herself in the afterlife as well, and also gives cause to the spread of filth in society.
Turk_Translation_2: In addition to spoiling hers and her husband's afterlife, she is also becoming the cause of spreading corruption in society.
Turk_Translation_3: She not only destroys her salvation and her husband's salvation but also becomes a cause of spreading corruption in society.
Turk_Translation_4: They ruin their Aakhirat along with that of their husbands and become a huge reason to spread this filth in society.

Urdu: اسلام اسلام کا راگ الاپنے سے کچھ نہیں ہوتا ہم حقیقتاُ وہی پسند کرتے ہیں جو ہمارے رسم و رواج ہوتے ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: It's no use talking about Islam; in reality we only like what goes along with our traditions and customs.
Turk_Translation_2: Repeating the name of Islam brings nothing; factually we like only those things that are in accordance with our customs and traditions.
Turk_Translation_3: Singing the songs of Islam is useless because we actually like the things that are according to our customs and traditions.
Turk_Translation_4: Nothing happens by only blowing the trumpet of Islam. We actually like whatever is in our culture and custom.

Urdu: مثلاً ونی، کاری، لڑکیوں کو تعلیم سے بے بہرہ رکھنا اور پسند کی شادی پر ڈز۔
Turk_Translation_1: For instance trading girls for marriage, killing girls for accusations of adultery, depriving girls of an education, and shooting them for marrying of their own choice.
Turk_Translation_2: For example, Wani, Kari, keeping the girls illiterate and gun bullet for the marriage of own choice.
Turk_Translation_3: For instance Vanni, Kari, keeping the girls illiterate and killings by gun shots on love marriage.
Turk_Translation_4: For example TV, vehicles and keeping girls away from education, and there is a fear about marrying by one's own choice.

Urdu: رہا آپ والا سوال تو بڑے صاحب بیوہ کو گھر لانے کے بجائے خود کسی بیوہ کے گھر چلے جاتے تو وارثین اوپر اوپر سے شورو غوغا کر کے چُپ اور مطمئن ہوجاتے (ہاں بیوہ کے وارثین کے پیٹ میں پھر مروڑ اُٹھتی)۔
Turk_Translation_1: As far as your question is concerned, instead of bringing the widow to his own home, if the man had gone to the widow's home, his heirs would have settled down and been satisfied after making some fuss about it (although the widow's heirs would then become jealous).
Turk_Translation_2: As far your question is concerned, instead of bringing the widow to his home, if the gentleman had gone to the widow's home, the relatives would have become quiet after making some formal hue and cry (but this would have disturbed the stomachs of the widow's relatives).
Turk_Translation_3: As far as your question is concerned, had the old man shifted to the widow's house after marriage rather than bringing her home, his heirs would have made token protests and then gone quiet and content (the heirs of the widow would then have had butterflies in their stomachs).
Turk_Translation_4: As far as your question is concerned, then Mister, why do you bring a widow home? Instead, you should be going to her house so that the relatives keep quiet after creating artificial havoc (well, there will be a stomach ache in the widow's family).

Urdu: برصغیر پاک و ہند میں ہم نے اسلام تو صدیوں پہلے قبول کر لیا مگر اس جاہلانہ سوچ سے پیچھا آج تک نہ چھڑا سکے اور رسم و رواج کو اسلام سے مقدم ہی جانا۔
Turk_Translation_1: Although we accepted Islam in the Indian sub-continent centuries ago, to this day we have not been able to get rid of this ignorant mindset and still prefer tradition and custom over Islam.
Turk_Translation_2: In the Indo-Pak subcontinent, we accepted Islam centuries ago, but could not get rid of irrational beliefs till today and gave preference to customs and traditions upon religion.
Turk_Translation_3: We embraced Islam many centuries back in the Indian subcontinent but could not get rid of this ignorant mindset and preferred customs and traditions to Islam.
Turk_Translation_4: In the Indo-Pak sub-continent, we embraced Islam many centuries ago, but we could not get away with this thinking and preferred customs and traditions to Islam.

Urdu: مرد کی دوسری شادی کو واہیات، طلاق کو کلنک کا ٹیکا، طلاق یافتہ عورت کو اچھوت، پسند کی شادی کو عزت پر داغ اور مرد کی اپنے سے بڑی عمر کی عورت سے شادی کو اس عورت کی مکاری کا نتیجہ سمجھنا اسی سوچ کی وجہ سے ہی ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: A man's second marriage is obscene, divorce is a blot that cannot be hidden, a divorced woman is untouchable, marriage by choice ruins reputations, and a man's marriage with a older woman is seen as a result of the woman's trickery. All these attitudes reflect the same mindset.
Turk_Translation_2: Terming a man's second marriage as immoral, divorce a sign of shame, a divorced woman as an untouchable, love marriage as a sign of disrespect and a man marrying a woman of higher age as the cleverness of woman, is a result of this way of thinking.
Turk_Translation_3: To consider the second marriage of a man as livid, divorce as a stigma, a divorced woman as an untouchable, love marriage as a shameful act, and the marriage of a younger man with an older woman as a sign of her wickedness are the results of this particular mindset.
Turk_Translation_4: Because of this pattern of thinking, we consider a second marriage of a male as bad, divorce as a blot, divorcee women an untouchable, marriage of one's choice as a stain on one's honor, and marriage of a man with an aged woman is considered a deceitful tactics of the woman.

Urdu: اور تو اور مغربی اقوام کی نقل میں ہم پرہیزگاری اور پردے کو دقیانوسی قرار دیتے ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: And to copy the Western nations we call abstinence and using the veil an outdated thing.
Turk_Translation_2: As a result of blindly following the culture of Western nations, we regard Purdah and virtuousness as outdated concepts.
Turk_Translation_3: Furthermore, in the footsteps of the western nations we declare abstention and Purdah as old fashioned.
Turk_Translation_4: On top of that, while imitating the West, we condemn prayers and Pardah as old fashioned.

Urdu: اسلام قبول کرنا تو آسان تھا اس سوچ سے پیچھا چھڑانا بہت مشکل۔
Turk_Translation_1: Accepting Islam was easy; getting rid of this mindset is very difficult.
Turk_Translation_2: It was easier to accept Islam but it was very difficult to get rid of thoughts like this.
Turk_Translation_3: It was easier to embrace Islam than to get rid of that mindset.
Turk_Translation_4: Embracing Islam was easy but getting away from this thought was tough.

Urdu: اللہ ھم سب کو اس کی ہمت اور جراٰت عطا فرماےء۔
Turk_Translation_1: May Allah give us all the strength and courage for this.
Turk_Translation_2: May Allah give us all the courage and boldness to do this.
Turk_Translation_3: May God grant us power and courage for this.
Turk_Translation_4: May Allah give us audacity for this.

Urdu: آمین۔
Turk_Translation_1: Amen.
Turk_Translation_2: Ameen.
Turk_Translation_3: Ameen.
Turk_Translation_4: Ameen.

Urdu: اردو لکھنا اتنا کٹھن تو کبھی نہ تھا۔
Turk_Translation_1: Writing Urdu was never this hard.
Turk_Translation_2: Writing Urdu had never been so difficult.
Turk_Translation_3: Writing in Urdu was never so difficult.
Turk_Translation_4: Writing Urdu was never this tough.

Urdu: صدیاں بیت گیںٰ اتنا سا لکھتے لکھتے۔
Turk_Translation_1: Centuries have passed since I've written so much.
Turk_Translation_2: Centuries have passed writing this much.
Turk_Translation_3: It has taken me centuries to write just this much.
Turk_Translation_4: It took ages to write this little.

Urdu: تھوڑے کو بہت جانیے۔
Turk_Translation_1: Consider this little bit enough.
Turk_Translation_2: Consider the less too much.
Turk_Translation_3: Be content with this little effort.
Turk_Translation_4: Think more of the less I wrote.

Urdu: اللہ حافظ۔
Turk_Translation_1: May Allah protect you.
Turk_Translation_2: May God protect you.
Turk_Translation_3: May God take care of you.
Turk_Translation_4: Allah Hafiz

Urdu: امیر تیمور اپنی کتاب “ میں ہوں تیمور “ میں لکھتا ہے کہ میں نے اپنی زندگی میں یہ راز پایا کہ اگر کسی فوج کا سپہ سالار صف اول میں ہوگا تو وہ فوج کبھی ناکام نہیں‌ہوگی۔
Turk_Translation_1: Ameer Taimur in his book I Am Taimur writes that I have learned one thing in life - if the commander of an army is on the front line that army will never lose.
Turk_Translation_2: Amir Taimur in his book "I am Taimur" writes that the life secret he learned in his life is that if the commander of an army stays at the front position, that army will never face defeat.
Turk_Translation_3: Amir Timur wrorte in his book 'I am Timur' that if the head of an army was found in the first line of attack, that army would never be defeated.
Turk_Translation_4: Ameer Taimur thus writes in his book "I am Taimur", "I learned this secret in my life: that if a Commander-in-Chief of an army stands in the line of fire, that army will never be defeated.

Urdu: لیکن ادھر تو حالات ہی اور ہیں
Turk_Translation_1: But here, the situation is totally different.
Turk_Translation_2: But here the situation is opposite.
Turk_Translation_3: But here the conditions are entirely different
Turk_Translation_4: But here, the situation is something else.

Urdu: یہ کہتے ہیں عوام تو ہوتی ہی ہمارے لیے مرنے کے لیے ہم مریں تو شہید
Turk_Translation_1: They say, "The common people are here to die for us. If we die, we're martyrs."
Turk_Translation_2: They say that the public is only to die for us and if we die we are martyrs.
Turk_Translation_3: these guys say that the public is destined to die for us and if we die, we are martyrs
Turk_Translation_4: They say that people are there to die for us. If I die, I am martyred.

Urdu: عوام میں سے کوئی مرے تو قتل
Turk_Translation_1: If a common person dies, it's just a casualty.
Turk_Translation_2: And if someone from the public dies he is assassinated.
Turk_Translation_3: the death of a commoner is nothing more than a murder
Turk_Translation_4: If a commoner dies, he is killed.

Urdu: السلام علیکم ورحمۃ وبرکاتہ،
Turk_Translation_1: Peace, mercy, and blessing be upon you.
Turk_Translation_2: Assalam-o-Alaikum Wa Rehamat Wa Barakatu
Turk_Translation_3: Assalam-o-Alaikum wa Rehma' wa Barakatu,
Turk_Translation_4: Assalamu Alaikum Wa Rahmatullahi Wa Barakatahu,

Urdu: آج رات عشاء کی نماز کے بعد میں وآپس دکان کی طرف آرہاتھاکہ ایک آدمی نے جوکہ ایک گاڑی میں بیٹھاہواتھااس نے ہاتھـ اٹھایااورمجھے اپنی طرف متوجہ کیا۔
Turk_Translation_1: Tonight when I was coming back to the shop after prayers, a man sitting in a car raised his hand to call my attention.
Turk_Translation_2: Today after Isha prayer, while I was coming back towards the shop, a man, sitting in a car, signaled by raising his hand towards me to get my attention.
Turk_Translation_3: I was returning to the shop after Isha'a prayers tonight when a man who was sitting in a car lifted his hand and got my attention.
Turk_Translation_4: Today, after Isha prayers, when I was coming towards my shop, a man who was sitting in a vehicle raised his hand and summoned me.

Urdu: میں نے سوچاکہ شایدکے یہ آدمی راستہ بھول گیاہے یاکچھـ پوچھناچاہتاہے میں رک گیاتواسکی گاڑی میں اسکی پوری فیملی بیٹھی ہوئی تھی۔
Turk_Translation_1: I thought, maybe he's lost or wants to ask me something. I stopped and saw that his whole family was sitting in the car.
Turk_Translation_2: I thought perhaps this man has forgotten the way or wants to ask something; I stopped and saw his whole family sitting in the car.
Turk_Translation_3: I thought that the man might have lost the way or wanted to ask something. I stopped. He had his family in his car.
Turk_Translation_4: I thought this man has forgotten his way or wanted to ask something. I stopped, and when I looked into the car, his whole family was in it.

Urdu: اس نے اپنامدعابیان کیاکہ میں عربی اچھی طرف سمجھـ سکتاہوں کہ نہیں میں نے کہاکہ کوئی مسئلہ نہیں ہےآپ بتاؤکہ کیابات ہے؟
Turk_Translation_1: He asked me if I could understand Arabic well or not. I said, "No problem, tell me what's the matter."
Turk_Translation_2: He asked whether I could fully understand Arabic; I said no problem tell me the issue.
Turk_Translation_3: He told his objective and said that he was not sure if he could understand Arabic well or not and I told him that it was not a problem and he should tell his story.
Turk_Translation_4: He asked me if I understand Arabic well. I said, no problem; tell me what is the matter.

Urdu: اس نے کہناشروع کیاکہ میں ریاض سے آیاہوں یہاں مدینہ میں لیکن کسی نے میری جیب کاٹ لی ہے آپ براہ مہربانی کوئی مدد کریں میں نے کہا کہ معاف کرو بھائی، کیونکہ ایساہی ایک واقع میرے ساتھـ پہلے ہوچکاہے کہ میں نے اس بندہ کوبیس ریال دئیے کہ اس سے پٹرول بھرا کرریاض چلے جاؤ لیکن اس نے تھوڑا ساآگے جاکرپھروہی کام شروع کردیا۔
Turk_Translation_1: He said, "I have come here to Madina from Riyaz, but someone has pick pocketed me. Please help me." I said, "Sorry brother, I've fallen for this trick before. I gave a guy twenty riyals to fill up with petrol to go to Riyaz, but he just went a little way down the road and started telling people the same story."
Turk_Translation_2: He started saying that I came from Riyadh to Medina and someone picked my pocket and so could you please help me; I said for him to excuse me because a similar incident had already happened to me when I gave 20 Riyals to a person to buy petrol with this money and get back to Riyadh, but he, after going a little distance, started doing the same thing.
Turk_Translation_3: He started to say that he had come from Riyadh but here in Madina, someone had picked his pocket and requested me to help him. I asked him to excuse me because I had already experienced such an incident where I gave a person 20 Riyals and asked him to get the petrol tank filled and go to Riyadh, but he started the same thing a little further on the way.
Turk_Translation_4: He started saying, "I came from Riyaz to Madinah but someone picked my pocket. Please help me." I asked for an excuse because one such incident had happened to me even earlier. I gave that man a note of 20 Riyals to get the gasoline to go back to Riyaz, but after going a little ahead he started to do it again.

Urdu: مجھے بڑا غصہ آیامیں نے اس کو بہت بولااورسپاہی کی دھمکی دی تووہ نودوگیارہ ہوگیا۔
Turk_Translation_1: I got really angry and tried to scare him off saying I'd call a cop, so he took off.
Turk_Translation_2: I felt considerably annoyed, scolded him and he then ran away when I gave him a threat of police.
Turk_Translation_3: I was enraged and I scolded him and threatened him with Police. At this, he ran away.
Turk_Translation_4: I got very angry- I shouted at him and threatened to call the police. Then he ran away.

Urdu: تواب یہ حالت ہوگئی ہے ہم مسلمانوں کی مانگنے کے لئے بھی گاڑیوں پرسوارہوکرساتھـ فیملی کے ساتھـ آتے ہیں اوردن بھرمیں کم ازکم دوتین ہزارکی دھاڑی لگاتے ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: The situation has become such that we Muslims take our family with us on a car to beg and make at least two to three thousand a day.
Turk_Translation_2: Now we Muslims have reached a position where we are using the car with family for begging purposes and make a minimum of two, three-thousand on a daily basis.
Turk_Translation_3: The situation now is such that we Muslims come in cars with families to beg and easily swindle two or three thousand in a day.
Turk_Translation_4: This is the situation of us Muslims- we come with our families in cars to beg and earn at least two to three thousand a day.

Urdu: جبکہ واضح حدیث (صلی اللہ علیہ والہ وسلم) ہاتھـ کے نیچے والے سے اوپروالاہاتھـ بہترہے نیچے والاہاتھـ مانگنے والااوراوپروالاہاتھـ دینے والاہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: Whereas there is a clear tradition (may Allah bless him and give him peace) that says that the upper hand is better than the lower hand because the upper hand gives while the lower one takes.
Turk_Translation_2: There exists a clear saying of the Holy Prophet (SAWS) that the upper hand is better than the lower one; because the lower hand is that of a taker and the upper hand is that of a giver.
Turk_Translation_3: Although there is a renowned Hadith (Peace be Upon Him) that the upper hand is better than the lower hand. Lower hand means the hand of the taker and the upper hand means the hand of the giver.
Turk_Translation_4: While there is a clear Hadith (PBUH), the upper hand is better than the underhand, and the upper hand is the hand of the giver.

Urdu: اللہ تعالی ہم پراپناکرم کرے اورہم کوسچامسلمان بنائے (آمین ثم آمین)
Turk_Translation_1: (May the most high Allah be kind to us and make us true Muslims. Amen.)
Turk_Translation_2: May Allah bless us with His kindness and make us true Muslims. (Ameen)
Turk_Translation_3: May God bless us from His bounty and make us true Muslims. (Ameen=)
Turk_Translation_4: (May Allah bless us and make us good Muslims. Ameen)

Urdu: والسلام
Turk_Translation_1: Peace to you
Turk_Translation_2: Wassalam
Turk_Translation_3: Was-Salam
Turk_Translation_4: Wassalam

Urdu: جاویداقبال
Turk_Translation_1: Javed Iqbal
Turk_Translation_2: Javed Iqbal
Turk_Translation_3: Javed Iqbal
Turk_Translation_4: Javed Iqbal

Urdu: ممتاز گلوکار عدنان سمیع پر ان کی اہلیہ نے تشدد کرنے کا الزام عائد کرتے ہوئے ممبئی کے ایک تھانے پہنچ گئیں
Turk_Translation_1: Distinguished singer Adnan Sami's wife went to a police station in Mumbai, accusing him of beating her.
Turk_Translation_2: The wife of the famous singer, Adnan Sami's wife, reached a police station in Mumbai and blamed him for violence,
Turk_Translation_3: Famous singer Adnan Sami's wife, while accusing him of torture, reached a Mumbai police station
Turk_Translation_4: The wife of the famous singer Adnaan Sami, in a police complaint, has accused him of violence.

Urdu: ،تھانے نے انہیں عدالت سے رجوع کرنے کی ہدایت کی ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: The police have advised her to go to court.
Turk_Translation_2: the Police Station has advised her to seek the advice of the court.
Turk_Translation_3: The police station has directed her to invoke the court.
Turk_Translation_4: Police had instructed her to file a lawsuit.

Urdu: عدنان سمیع کی بیوی صباء گلاداری نے اپنے شوہر کے خلاف درخواست دی کہ عدنان سمیع ان پر مسلسل تشدد کرتے ہیں
Turk_Translation_1: Adnan Sami's wife Sabah Guladari filed a petition against her husband that he constantly beats her,
Turk_Translation_2: Adnan Sami's wife Saba Galadari has lodged a complaint against her husband Adnan Sami that he consistently commits violence
Turk_Translation_3: Adnan Sami's wife Saba Galadhari has filed a petition against her husband stating that Adnan Sami consistently tortures her
Turk_Translation_4: Saba Guladari, wife of Adnaan Sami, had moved a petition accusing her husband of continuous violence

Urdu: اور غیر انسانی سلوک روا رکھے ہوئے ہیں،
Turk_Translation_1: treats her inhumanely,
Turk_Translation_2: and inhuman treatment against her.
Turk_Translation_3: and has subjected her to inhuman treatment,
Turk_Translation_4: and inhuman behavior.

Urdu: اب یہ بات ان کی برداشت سے باہر ہوگئی ہے لہٰذا عدنان سمیع کے خلاف مقدمہ درج کیا جائے
Turk_Translation_1: and now this has become unbearable for her so a case should be filed against Adnan Sami.
Turk_Translation_2: Since this has crossed the limit of her tolerance, therefore, a court case should be registered against Adnan Sami.
Turk_Translation_3: she cannot bear it anymore and a case, therefore, may be registered against Adnan Sami
Turk_Translation_4: Now she can not tolerate it. So, a case has been registered against Adnaan Sami.

Urdu: ،پولیس نے مقدمہ درج کرنے کی بجائے یہ کہہ کر انہیں عدالت سے رجوع کرنے کی ہدایت کی کہ یہ معاملہ قابل دست اندازی پولیس نہیں ہے۔
Turk_Translation_1: The police advised her to go to the court instead of filing a case, saying that they could not get involved in the matter.
Turk_Translation_2: Instead of registering the case, the police advised her to consult the court, because this case is outside its jurisdiction.
Turk_Translation_3: Rather than registering the case, the police asked her to invoke the court since the matter cognizable by the police.
Turk_Translation_4: Police have instructed her to file a lawsuit as this case was not the responsibility of the police.

Urdu: آپ کے خیال میں عدنان سمیع پر ان کی اہلیہ کا الزام درست ہے؟
Turk_Translation_1: In your opinion, is Adnan Sami's wife's accusation against him true?
Turk_Translation_2: Do you think the allegations of Adnan Sami's wife are correct?
Turk_Translation_3: Are, in your opinion, the allegations leveled against Adnan Sami by his wife justified?
Turk_Translation_4: What do you think about the allegations made by Adnaan Sami's wife?

Turk_Translation_1: Malik Babar Hussain, Jeddah. It is very sad that even in modern times, such traditions of ignorance are still in place. Landowners and others with power and prestige use their tyrannical authority to target innocent people. Who would call them Muslim?

Urdu: راس الخیمہ، امریکہ کی شرارت سے یہس بیان بازی ہورہی ہے امریکہ کا دماغ تو ہے ہی خراب مگر اب بھارت کا بھی یہی حال ہے حملہ کرکے تو دیکھے حقیقت معلوم ہوجائے گی کون کتنا پانی میں ہے

Turk_Translation_4: Ras-ul-khema, there are debates and discussions because of America's mischief. America was always arrogant, but now even India is doing the same. Let them attack us- they will taste a bit of reality.

Turk_Translation_1: Israel is attacking Hamas, but no one has the guts to stop them. India, too - following the pattern of Israel - India, too, wants to do something like this.
Turk_Translation_2: Israel is launching attacks on Hamas, but no one has the courage to stop it; India too wants to follow Israel to do the same.
Turk_Translation_3: Israel is attacking upon Hamas but no one dares to stop it. Taking a cue from Israel, India also wants to do so.
Turk_Translation_4: Israel is attacking Hamas, but no one has the moral courage to stop it, like Israel, India wants to do the same.

Urdu: وزیر اعظم سید یوسف رضاء گیلانی نے کہا ہے کہ امریکی نو منتخب نائب صدر جوبائیڈن نے سابق صدر مشرف کی وردی اتروانے اور لولی لنگڑی جمہوریت بحال کروانے میں اہم کردار ادا کیا ہے،اس لئے حکومت پاکستان نے انہیں ستارہ امتیاز سے نوازا۔
Turk_Translation_1: Prime Minister Syed Yousaf Raza Gilani has said that the American Vice President-elect Joe Biden played an important role in making ex-President Musharraf step down from office and in bringing back the sham of democracy, which is why the government of Pakistan awarded him the Sitara-e-Imtiaz.
Turk_Translation_2: Prime Minister Yousuf Raza Gilani has said that the newly-elected American Vice President, Joe Biden, played an important role in ex-president Musharraf, leaving his army chief post and the reinstatement of a lame democracy and, therefore, the Government of Pakistan has awarded him with Sitara-e-Imtiaz.
Turk_Translation_3: Prime Minister Syed Yousaf Raza Gilani has said that the newly elected American Vice President Joe Biden played an important role in the removal of the uniform of the former President Musharraf and the reinstatement of a crippled democracy, so the government has bestowed upon him the Sitara-e-Imtiaz.
Turk_Translation_4: Prime Minister Sayyed Yusuf Raza Geelani said that new American Vice President Joe Biden played a vital role in removing the uniform of ex-president Musharraf and restoring this handicapped democracy. That is why we honored him with Sitara-e-Imtiyaz.

Urdu: وردی اتروانے اور جمہوریت کی بحالی میں کسی سیاسی جماعت کو کریڈٹ نہیں جانا چاہئے، پارلیمنٹ ربر اسٹمپ نہیں ہے،
Turk_Translation_1: No political party should get the credit for making someone step down from office or the restoration of democracy. Parliament is not a rubber stamp.
Turk_Translation_2: The credit for Musharraf leaving his army chief post and the reinstatement of democracy should not go to any political party. The parliament is not a rubber stamp.

Turk_Translation_1: American President George W. Bush said in his final press conference that he made a lot of mistakes during his term as president and advised President-elect Barack Obama to do what he feels is right.
Turk_Translation_2: The American President, George W Bush, in his farewell press conference, advising the newly elected President Barack Obama, said that he made many mistakes during the period of his presidency and Barack Obama should do whatever he deems appropriate.
Turk_Translation_3: In his farewell press conference, President Bush said to the newly elected President Barack Obama by the way of advice that he made many mistakes during his reign and Barack Obama should do what he considers right.
Turk_Translation_4: American President George Bush, in his last press conference as President, said advising newly elected President Barak Obama that he made many mistakes during his tenure, and Barak Obama should go ahead doing what he feels is right.

Turk_Translation_1: As president I acted in keeping with circumstances and the American Constitution and law, and I gave preference to American interests over my own popularity.

Turk_Translation_2: He said that even today the enemies of America are planning to attack America; the greatest challenge for Barack Obama will be to stop these attacks.

Turk_Translation_1: He said, "My greatest disappointment is not having found the weapons of mass destruction from Iraq and my biggest mistake was to accept that the mission in Iraq was completed."

Turk_Translation_2: This is a highly heartbreaking incident that Israelis are committing the mass murder of Palestinians; here in Kashmir the situation is not different, but the Security Council does not pay any heed to it.
Turk_Translation_3: It's a very painful tragedy that Israelis are massacring Palestinians and the same situation exists in Kashmir but the Security Council takes no notice at all.
Turk_Translation_4: This is a very painful tragedy that Israelis are killing Palestinians, and Kashmir is facing the same problem, but the Security Council does not seem to be paying any heed to it, quite unmoved.

Urdu: جتنی بھی تنظیمیں جو فلسطین اور کشمیر میں موجود ہیں انہیں چاہیئے کہ اپنی آزادی تک جنگ جاری رکھین اور ان میں اتھاد پیدا کرتے ہوئے ہر قسم کی جارحیت کا مقابلہ کرتے رہیں ایک نہ ایک دن ان کی شہادت رنگ لائے گی انشاءاللہ
Turk_Translation_1: Whatever organizations are present in Palestine and Kashmir should continue their struggle until they are free and, creating unity amongst themselves, continue to fight against any type of aggression. One day, Allah willing, their martyrdom will produce results.
Turk_Translation_2: All the organizations currently present in Palestine and Kashmir should keep on fighting till their independence and by creating unity among themselves continue to fight all types of aggressions; their martyrdom will one day come up with flying colors with the grace of God.
Turk_Translation_3: All the organizations present in Palestine and Kashmir should continue their war till the independence and combat the aggression by standing united. One day their martyrdom will bear fruits by the will of God.
Turk_Translation_4: All the organizations that are present in Palestine and Kashmir should keep the fight going until they get freedom. They should remain united to sustain all kinds of attack, Insha Allah. Their Martyrdom will not go in vain.

Urdu: غزہ پر اسرائیلی فضائی حملے بدستور جاری ہیں، اب تک سینکڑوں فلسطینی مرد، خواتین اور بچے شہید ہوچکے ہیں۔

Turk_Translation_3: Israeli air strikes on Gaza are still continuing. Hundreds of Palestinian men, women and children have been martyred so far.
Turk_Translation_4: Israeli air strikes on Gaza are still on. Hundreds of Palestinian men, women and children have been martyred by now.

Turk_Translation_1: Nizar Rayyan, an important Hamas political leader, has been martyred along with his wife and children.

Turk_Translation_3: Hamas' key political leader Nazarian has been martyred along with his wife and children.
Turk_Translation_4: Nazaryan, an important Hamas political leader, was martyred with his wife and children.

Turk_Translation_1: The whole world raised a fuss over the Mumbai events, but why can't anyone, including America and Britain, see the massacre taking place under the Israeli attacks?
Turk_Translation_2: The whole world began crying over the Mumbai attacks, but America and Britain have been unable to see the mass bloodshed as a result of the Israeli strikes.

Turk_Translation_4: The whole world shouts in one voice against the Mumbai attacks but no one, including America and Britain, seems to be bothered about Israeli attacks that are killing hundreds of innocent citizens.

Turk_Translation_4: What you have to say about this dual standard of the world?

Turk_Translation_1: I think the point is that most of our nation is illiterate; they don't even know where their money is going. The government has an interest to fulfill its responsibilities by levying taxes. The electricity and gas crisis will remain the same,
Turk_Translation_2: In my view, the real issue is that the majority of our nation is uneducated; they don't know where their money is going; the government is interested in discharging its responsibilities by imposing taxes; the electricity and gas shortage will continue to exist in the same way.

Turk_Translation_1: On the other hand, since January 1 gas rates have been increased by eight percent on the average, while the unavailability of petrol is a cause of serious concern for people in various cities of the country.

Urdu: بھارت بغیر کسی ثبوت کے ممبئی حملوں کا الزام ان تنظیموں پر کیوں عائد کررہا ہے؟
Turk_Translation_1: Why is India accusing these organizations of the Mumbai attacks without any proof?
Turk_Translation_2: Why is India, without any proof, blaming these organizations for the Mumbai attacks?
Turk_Translation_3: Why is India accusing these organizations of the Mumbai attacks in absence of any proof?
Turk_Translation_4: Why is India blaming these organizations for the Mumbai terrorist attack without any evidence?

Urdu: کیا بھارت میں دہشت گرد تنظیمیں موجود نہیں؟
Turk_Translation_1: Are there no terrorist organizations in India?
Turk_Translation_2: Are there no terrorist organizations in India?
Turk_Translation_3: Are there no terrorist organizations in India?
Turk_Translation_4: Are there no terrorist outfits in India?

Urdu: ، کیا بھارت میں اقلیتوں پر ہونے والے مظالم سے عالمی ادارے واقف نہیں؟
Turk_Translation_1: Are global organizations not aware of the oppression being done in India against the minorities?
Turk_Translation_2: Are the international bodies not aware of the atrocities being committed against minorities in India?
Turk_Translation_3: Are the international organizations not aware of the cruelties being meted out to the minorities in India?
Turk_Translation_4: Are international organizations unaware of the atrocities committed to the minorities in India?

Urdu: ہمیں اپنی رائے سے آگاہ کریں۔
Turk_Translation_1: Tell us what you think.
Turk_Translation_2: Give us your opinion.
Turk_Translation_3: Inform us of your opinion.
Turk_Translation_4: Send in your opinion.

Urdu: عید کا تہوارخوشیوں اور مسرتوں کا ترجمان ہوتا ہے اور فرزندان توحید عیدالاضحی پر سنت ابراہیمی پر عمل کرتے ہوئے جانوروں کی قربانی کرتے ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: The Eid holiday is an expression of joy and happiness, and Muslims, following the tradition of Abraham, sacrifice animals on Eid-ul-Azha.
Turk_Translation_2: The Eid festival is a symbol of happiness and enjoyment and on Eid ul Adha, the believers of one God, following the tradition of Ibrahim offer animal sacrifices.
Turk_Translation_3: The festival of Eid is a harbinger of happiness and joy and, following the tradition of Abraham, the monotheists sacrifice animals on Eid-ul-Azha.
Turk_Translation_4: The Festival of Eid represents happiness and bliss, and the sons of Islam sacrifice animals following the Sunnah of Hadrat Ibrahim.

Urdu: اس پر آشوب دور میں جب مہنگائی عروج پر ہو سیاسی حالات دگرگوں ہوں ، اس کے باوجودامیر اور غریب سب ہی اپنی استطاعت کے مطابق عید کی تیاری کرتے ہیں اور مختلف طریقوں سے اپنے احباب کو عید کی مبارکباد دیتے ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: In these disturbing times when inflation is at its peak and the political situation has deteriorated, in spite of this both rich and poor prepare for Eid, as best they can and wish their loved ones a happy Eid, in different ways.
Turk_Translation_2: In this turbulent age, when the inflation is at its peak and political conditions are aggravated, regardless of all this, both poor and rich prepare for Eid according to their financial capacity and greet their relatives in different ways.
Turk_Translation_3: In this difficult age, when inflation is at its highest and the political situation is vulnerable, the rich and the poor prepare for Eid to the best of their ability and send Eid greetings to their loved ones in many ways.
Turk_Translation_4: In such trying times and even in an age when prices are high and the political situation is unstable, everyone, rich and the poor alike, prepares for Eid according to his status, wishing one's relatives a good Eid in his own way.

Urdu: ہم بھی آپ کو بلاگ کے ذریعے ایک موقع فراہم کررہے ہیں کہ اپنے پیاروں کو مختصر پیغامات کی صورت میں عید کی مبارک باد دیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: We also are providing you an opportunity through the blog to wish your loved ones a happy Eid in the form of short messages.
Turk_Translation_2: We, too, are providing you an opportunity through blog to send brief messages of Eid greetings to your beloved ones.
Turk_Translation_3: We are also giving you a chance through the blog so that you may send your loved ones Eid greetings in the form of brief messages.
Turk_Translation_4: We are also providing you with an opportunity, through this blog, to wish Eid greetings to your loved ones.

Urdu: آپ عید کی مناسبت سے اشعار کے ذریعے بھی مبارکباد دے سکتے ہیں۔
Turk_Translation_1: You can also wish a happy Eid through verses of poetry that suit the occasion.
Turk_Translation_2: You can also congratulate, through poetic stanzas, appropriate for Eid.
Turk_Translation_3: You can also send greetings in the form of verses suitable for Eid.
Turk_Translation_4: You can post Eid-related couplets as well.

Urdu: -مرتضی جیلانی،
Turk_Translation_1: Murtaza Gilani,
Turk_Translation_2: Murtaza Jilani.
Turk_Translation_3: Murtaza Jilani.
Turk_Translation_4: Murtuza Jeelani,

Urdu: کراچی، ہمارے حکمرانوں کو یہ بات سمجھ لینی چاہیئے کہ جن کے خلاف وہ آپریشن کر رہے ہیں وہی پاکستان کے قدردان ہیں جو ہر قسم کے ظلم سہہ رہے ہیں لیکن پاکستان سے محبت کرتے ہیں
Turk_Translation_1: Karachi. Our rulers should understand that the people that are conducting this operation against are fans of Pakistan; even though they're suffering this kind of oppression, they still love Pakistan.
Turk_Translation_2: Karachi. Our rulers should understand that the people against whom they are carrying out operations on are those who love Pakistan; they are suffering from all types of aggressions but still love Pakistan.
Turk_Translation_3: Karachi. Our rulers should understand that the people they are fighting against are the true patrons of Pakistan. They have been suffering from every act of cruelty but still love Pakistan.
Turk_Translation_4: Karachi. Our rulers should understand one thing: that the people against whom they have started these operations are the people who care about Pakistan - those who are bearing all kinds of cruelty but still love Pakistan.

Urdu: اگر جنگ ہوئی تو وہی پاکستان کے شانہ بشانہ لڑیں گے
Turk_Translation_1: If there were a war, they would fight shoulder-to-shoulder with Pakistan.
Turk_Translation_2: They will fight shoulder-to-shoulder with Pakistan if there occurred a war;
Turk_Translation_3: If a war starts, they will stand by Pakistan.
Turk_Translation_4: If there is a war, they will be the people to fight shoulder to shoulder with the Pakistan army.

Urdu: جب ان کی محبت کا احساس ہوگا، صرف احتجاجی سیاست سے کچھ حاصل نہ ہوگا، میرے خیال مین دونوں کے درمیان فیصلہ کن جنگ کا امکان ہے تاکہ بھڑاس نکل جائے۔
Turk_Translation_1: When their love is felt, nothing is to be gained by politics of protest; I think there could be a decisive war between the two so that they can take out their frustrations.
Turk_Translation_2: when their love will be realized. Nothing would be achieved only with the politics of agitation; in my opinion, there is a possibility of a decisive war between both so that they get satisfied.
Turk_Translation_3: When we shall feel their love. Politics of agitation won't yield anything. I think there is the chance of a decisive war between the two sides so that they may give vent to their anger.
Turk_Translation_4: Then you will realize how much love they have. Politics of anger will not solve anything. I think there are possibilities for a conclusive war between the two, so that the anger comes out.
